text: When your personnel present is facing a dilemma, you may discard the top card of your deck to choose one: that personnel becomes Klingon; or that personnel becomes [Rom]. These effects last until the end of that dilemma.

name: L'Kor Ranking Elder
text: When this personnel is an eligible target for a random selection, you may discard a Klingon from hand to exclude a [Rom] personnel (or two Klingons) present from that selection.

name: Tokath Keeping the Peace
text: When this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may place a Klingon in your discard pile on the bottom of his or her owner's deck to make your [Rom] personnel present lose all of his or her skills until the end of that dilemma.

name: Toq
text: When you play this personnel, if you command a unique [Rom] Klingon, you may discard a card from hand to draw two cards.

name: Vakis Misinformed Operative
text: When you play an Assassin, you may discard a card from hand to place that personnel on any headquarters mission or on any planet.

name: U.S.S. T'Kumbra Behind the Lines
text: When your personnel begin a mission attempt involving this ship, you may discard three cards from hand to allow each Vulcan aboard to meet Integrity and Strength requirements of this mission and each dilemma your personnel face at this mission using Cunning. These effects last until the end of the mission attempt.

name: D'Kora Transport
text: This ship is attributes +1 for each different Commodity event or Rule event in play (limit +5).

name: Manufactured Triumph *VP
text: Your opponent discards any number of personnel of different species from hand. Unless you have that number of personnel of different species, all your personnel are stopped.

name: Zefram Cochrane Ready to Make History *VP
skills: 2 Astrometrics Engineer 2 Navigation Physics Programming Science
text: When you play a ship at this mission, you may stop this personnel to make that ship cost -2.

name: A Sight for Sore Eyes *VP
text: To play this event, you must command three [SF] personnel. Plays in your core. At the start of each of your turns, score 5 points. At the end of each of your turns, if you have at least 5 points, lose 5 points.

name: Dignitaries and Witnesses *VP
text: Unless you have an Admiral or a General or 3 Leadership, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Necessary Execution *VP
text: Your opponent chooses a personnel to be killed. If you do not command a completed space mission, he or she chooses an additional personnel to be killed.

name: Distant Exploration *VP
text: Plays on your headquarters mission. When you complete a mission that has a different quadrant icon than this mission, score 5 points.

name: Organized Terrorist Activities *VP
text: To play this event, you must command three [Fed][Maq] personnel. Lose 5 points to make an opponent place his or her hand on top of his or her deck. Then you may examine that deck and choose a non-ship card to remove from the game. He or she shuffles and replaces his or her deck. Remove this event from the game.

name: These Are The Voyages *VP
text: Draw a number of cards equal to the cost of one of your personnel, then place three cards from hand on the bottom of your deck in any order. Destroy this event.

name: Unyielding *VP
text: Plays in your core. When your [Bor] personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may place a [Bor] personnel from hand on this event to prevent that.

name: Dukat Anjohl Tennan *VP
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may remove an Anthropology or Leadership personnel in your discard pile from the game to make this personnel attributes +1 until the end of this mission attempt.

name: Odo Founder Adept Imposter *VP
text: When you are about to place an Infiltration card in your discard pile, if this personnel is present with an opponent's personnel, you may place that Infiltration card on top of your deck instead.

name: Shran In Archer's Debt *VP
text: When this personnel is stopped by a dilemma, you may discard a card from hand to take your overcome dilemma and place it on the bottom of your dilemma pile.

name: Ardent Predator
text: Randomly select two personnel. Unless those personnel have Exobiology and Cunning>11 or Strength>13, those personnel are killed.

name: Satarran Gambit
text: Unless you have Intelligence and Cunning > 32 or 2 Biology and Programming, your opponent may place an Infiltrator from hand aboard a ship at this mission (your opponent now commands that personnel) and all your personnel are stopped.

name: Shared Hallucination
text: When this dilemma is revealed, you may discard any number of cards from your hand. Choose a personnel to be stopped for each card in your hand.

name: Provocative Ploy
text: To play this event, you must command three [Rom] personnel. Plays on an opponent's incomplete non-headquarters mission. When that opponent's personnel begin a mission attempt at a different mission, he or she must discard a card from hand. When that opponent completes a mission, destroy this event.

name: Voluntary Withdrawal
text: Plays in your core. When you have drawn dilemmas, you may destroy this event to set one of those dilemmas aside, then return the others to your dilemma pile and draw one less dilemma than the number you returned. Add the dilemma you set aside to those drawn.

name: Aid Refugee Colony
skills: Engineer, Honor, Medical, Officer, and Integrity>34
text: When you complete this mission, you may take up to three Bajorans from your discard pile and place them on the bottom of your deck.

name: Locutus Almost Human
text: While you command a [Bor] non-Dissident personnel, this personnel loses all of his skills and his next ability. When an opponent's dilemma is revealed, you may stop your [Bor] Dissident present.

name: Beverly Crusher Encouraging Commander
text: While this personnel is aboard your {U.S.S. Enterprise-D}, each of your non-unique [TNG] personnel present is attributes +1.

name: Data Proud Father
skills: Anthropology Engineer Exobiology Physics 2 Programming Science
text: When you play this personnel, the next Android you play this turn is cost -2.

name: Miles O'Brien Conn Officer
text: While this personnel is attempting a mission, add the span of that mission to this personnel's attributes.

name: Tasha Yar Weapons Specialist
text: When you play this personnel, each player may download a Hand Weapon. While this personnel is equipped with a Hand Weapon, she gains Honor and Security and cannot be stopped by dilemmas.

name: William T. Riker William Odan
text: When your [TNG] personnel present is killed by a dilemma, you may discard a card from hand to make this personnel gain a skill from the killed personnel until the end of this mission attempt.

name: Toral Arrogant Child
text: When you play this personnel, you may download a Treachery Klingon.

name: Thadiun Okona Outrageous Rogue
text: When this personnel is randomly selected by a dilemma, the owner of that dilemma must destroy an event in his or her core.

name: Wesley Crusher Apprentice Traveler
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may stop each personnel present and remove him from the game to end your mission attempt. That dilemma and all remaining dilemmas in the dilemma stack are returned to their owner's dilemma pile.

name: Zorn Prevaricating Groppler
text: When you play this personnel, if any player commands a Commodity, you may play him at cost -1. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may stop him to take a Commodity from your discard pile into hand.

name: Geordi La Forge Sleeper Agent
text: Order - Return this personnel to his owner's hand to kill an opponent's Diplomacy personnel present.

name: U.S.S. Enterprise-D Loaded for Bear
text: Order - If you have a lower score than each of your opponents, stop three of your [TNG] personnel aboard this ship to score 5 points. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Hajur Veteran Fighter
text: When this personnel is killed by a dilemma, you may place him on the bottom of his owner's deck.

name: Back Room Dealings *VP
text: Choose a personnel who has Treachery or Integrity<4 to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

name: The Play's the Thing *VP
text: Plays in your core. When you play this event, chose [AU], [Fut], or [Pa]. Each personnel you own who costs 3 or more gains that icon. At the start of each of your turns, place a card from hand on this event.

name: Adversarial Trial
text: Randomly select a personnel who has Anthropology or Programming to be stopped. If you have more points than each of your opponents, randomly select a personnel to be returned to his or her owner's hand.

name: Ingenious Jury-rig
text: Choose a personnel who has Transporters to be stopped, then place this dilemma in your core. Non-Persistent dilemmas may not be returned to your dilemma pile from beneath your opponent's incomplete missions.

name: Overburdened
text: Reveal the top three cards of your dilemma pile. For each dilemma you reveal that costs 1 or more and does not require a skill, randomly select a personnel to be killed. Then place the revealed cards on the bottom of your dilemma pile in any order.

name: Pivotal Destiny
text: Place this dilemma in your core. You need an additional 10 points to win the game. When you command three completed missions, remove this dilemma from the game.

name: Standing Trial
text: Randomly select a personnel who has Honor or Transporters to be stopped. If you have more points than each of your opponents, randomly select a personnel to be returned to his or her owner's hand.

name: Workforce
text: Unless you have Physics, all your personnel are stopped. Otherwise, place this dilemma on this mission. While you command a stopped personnel at this mission, your personnel cannot begin a mission attempt here. At the end of this turn, this dilemma is overcome.

name: Boon of the Celestial Temple
text: To play this event, you must command {Bajor} and no other headquarters mission. Plays in your core. Cards an opponent owns cannot remove personnel in your discard pile from the game.

name: Emanations
text: Plays in your core. When any player is about to take an event or interrupt from his or her discard pile into hand, prevent that and place it on the bottom of its owner's deck.

name: Lineage
text: Place any number of cards from your hand on the bottom of your deck in any order and draw an equal number of cards. Then, if you command three [AU] personnel, you may draw up to two additional cards. Destroy this event.

name: Mouthpiece
text: To play this event, you must command three [Dom] personnel. Plays in your core. Your Vorta gain Acquisition and are Integrity +1.

name: Reliving the Past
text: Return two dilemmas beneath your incomplete non-headquarters mission to their owner's dilemma pile to score 5 points. Destroy this event.

keywords: Replicate - Discard two cards from hand. Temporal.
name: Temporal Transporters
text: Place a non-[Fut][Fed] personnel from your discard pile aboard your unique Temporal ship. Destroy this event.

name: Curious Companion
text: When a card an opponent owns returns any number of dilemmas to that opponent's dilemma pile from beneath your incomplete mission, score 5 points. Order - Place a Temporal card from your discard pile on the bottom of its owner's deck.

name: Disconcerting Displacement
text: When an opponent's personnel begins a mission attempt, discard two cards from hand to name a unique personnel. If the opponent's named personnel is not attempting the mission, place him or her present with the opponent's personnel that are attempting the mission. (He or she joins the mission attempt.) Remove this interrupt from the game.

name: Preposterous Plan
text: When an opponent scores 5 or more points, if he or she has not completed a mission, score 5 points. Order - Destroy an opponent's Temporal event.

name: Identify Temporal Disturbance
text: Your [AU] personnel may attempt and complete this mission with these requirements: Leadership, 2 Security, and Strength>32.

name: Icheb Second Officer
text: When you play this personnel, the next Temporal event you play this turn is cost -2.

name: Seven of Nine Undercover Operative
text: When you play this personnel, if you command a Temporal ship, you may download {Temporal Transporters}.

name: Historical Monitor
text: Order - Draw a card for each different Temporal event you command (limit 4). Then, reveal the top card of an opponent's deck. If it is not a personnel, shuffle this interrupt into your deck. Otherwise, remove this interrupt from the game.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Devidia II Access Temporal Conduit
skills: 2 Anthropology, Programming, Transporters, and Integrity>35 or 2 Exobiology, 2 Treachery, and Strength>35
text: When you play a Temporal event, if you have completed this mission, that event is cost -1.

name: Agricultural Assessment
skills: Archaeology, Biology, Geology, Cunning>36 and (Honor or Treachery)
text: At the start of each player's turn, that player may draw a card for each staffed ship he or she commands at this mission.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Contact Mysterious Benefactor
text: When your personnel complete this mission, if you command three or more different Temporal cards, score 5 points.

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
name: Enforce Quarantine
text: Non-Persistent dilemmas cannot be returned to your opponent's dilemma pile from beneath this mission by cards your opponents own.

name: Prevent Historical Disruption
text: At the start of each of your turns, you may discard 4 cards from hand to download a Temporal ship. While you do not command a headquarters mission, you may play Temporal ships at this mission.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Provoke Interstellar Incident
text: At the end of your first turn, if your opponent commands two or more headquarters missions, you may take an additional turn after this one.

name: Kaas Dromand Devoted Fanatic
text: When you play {Cultist Attack}, you may choose an opponent's personnel present to be killed. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Yaltar Draft Supervisor
text: Order - Stop this personnel to reveal the top three cards of your deck. You may place up to two Glinns revealed this way at your headquarters mission where each could be played, then stop those personnel. Discard the remaining cards.

name: Anthony Braxton Forward-thinking Recruiter
text: When you play this personnel, you may download a [Fed] personnel.

name: Fredericks
text: While this personnel is aboard your [Pa][TNG] ship, that ship is Range +1.

name: Jocelyn LoPresti Coming to Grips
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, if she gains a skill from {Mission Briefing}, she may gain any skill of your choice until the end of that dilemma.

name: Juel Ducane Above Reproach
skills: Anthropology Diplomacy Law Leadership Navigation Officer Transporters
text: When you play this personnel, you may take a [Fed] personnel from your discard pile and place him or her aboard your Temporal ship.

name: Marris
text: When you play this personnel, discard a card from hand.

name: Nog Defiant Captain
skills: Acquisition Diplomacy Engineer Honor Officer Physics
text: While this personnel is aboard your [DS9] ship, it is attributes +1 for each [Fut] personnel aboard (limit +4).

name: Rachel Garrett Restoring the Past
text: When an engagement involving this personnel aboard your [Pa][TNG] ship begins, you may kill this personnel to prevent that engagement and stop each personnel and ship involved.

name: Rhys Parker Fulfilling Destiny
text: When you play {Reconfiguration}, if this personnel is aboard your [Pa][TNG] ship, you may draw two cards.

name: Richard Castillo Assuming Command
text: When your corresponding Commander present aboard his or her ship is killed by a dilemma, you may make this personnel attributes +5 and gain two skills of your choice until the end of that mission attempt.

name: Simmons
text: When you play this personnel, you may draw three cards and discard two cards from hand.

name: Tasha Yar Requesting a Transfer
text: When you play this personnel, if you command a [Pa] card, she is cost -1. When this personnel is about to be killed, you may stop her to prevent that.

name: Gral Eager Opportunist
text: Cards an opponent owns cannot prevent copies of {Veiled Threat} you own.

name: B'Elanna Torres Mother of the Kuvah'magh
text: Order - If this personnel is aboard your staffed [Kli] ship, discard an event from hand to place that ship at your [DQ] mission. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Toral Son of Duras
text: When your {No Peace in Our Time} is about to be destroyed by a card an opponent owns, you may kill your [Kli] Treachery personnel present to prevent that.

name: Brota Son of Mogh
text: When an opponent plays an event that costs 2 or less, if he or she commands two or more headquarters missions, prevent that event and place it in its owner's discard pile. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Harcourt Fenton Mudd Honest Businessman
text: When a dilemma this personnel is facing is about to make a random selection, you may give command of your Commodity event to an opponent to choose an additional personnel present to include in that selection.

name: Martus Mazur Listener
text: When you play {Alien Gambling Device}, it is cost -4.

name: Miranda O'Brien Proud Descendant
text: When an opponent plays an interrupt, if he or she commands two or more headquarters missions, prevent that interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Odo Timeless
skills: Law Leadership Navigation 2 Programming Science Security
text: During each of your Play and Draw Cards segments, if an opponent commands two or more headquarters missions, you may spend 2 additional counters.

name: Yedrin Dax Heir Apostate
skills: Anthropology Astrometrics Diplomacy Physics Science Treachery
text: When an opponent downloads a card, if he or she commands two or more headquarters missions, place that card on the top of its owner's deck. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Telek R'Mor Anachronistic Visitor
text: You may play this personnel aboard your non-[Bor][Voy] ship. When this personnel uses a skill to complete a [DQ] mission, you may place him in his owner s discard pile to score 5 points.

name: Daniels Timeline Protector
text: While this personnel is in your discard pile, you may play him from your discard pile at cost +2.

name: Taluno Guardian
text: While you command {Line of Defense}, this ship and each of your {Generals} are attributes +2. When your Line of Defense is destroyed, you may take Line of Defense or a [Baj] card from your discard pile into hand.

name: Starship Enterprise Imperial Flagship
text: To play this ship, you must command four [AU][TOS] personnel. You may play this ship at cost +1 to name a unique [TOS] personnel you own. That personnel gains Commander: Starship Enterprise.

name: U.S.S. Enterprise-C Temporal Linchpin
text: While this ship is at a space mission, you may play [Pa][TNG] or [AU][TNG] personnel aboard this ship. You may do this only once each turn.

name: U.S.S. Relativity Federation Timeship
text: At the start of each of your turns, place each non-[Fut] personnel you command in his or her owner's discard pile. You may play [Fut][Fed] personnel and equipment aboard this ship. When a card instructs you to place this ship at your headquarters mission, you may place it at your [Fed] space mission.

name: U.S.S. Wells
text: When a card instructs you to place this ship at your headquarters mission, you may place it at your [Fed] space mission.

name: Khan Noonien Singh Genetically-Engineered Nemesis *VP
text: While present with an opponent's personnel, each of that opponent's personnel is attributes -1.

name: The Clown: Guillotine *VP
text: Your opponent names a skill. Randomly select a personnel with that skill. Unless that personnel has an attribute>6, randomly select a second personnel with that skill. Each selected personnel is killed and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Tsiolkovsky Infection *VP
text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost -1. Unless you have 2 Anthropology, 2 Programming, and Cunning>38 or 2 Biology, Exobiology, and 2 Medical, randomly select three personnel to be killed.

name: Whisper in the Dark *VP
text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost -1. Unless you have 2 Geology, 2 Physics, and Cunning>38 or 2 Honor, 2 Officer, and Transporters, randomly select three personnel to be killed.

name: Field Studies *VP
text: To play this event, you must command three [Fed] personnel at your space mission. Lose 5 points to revel the top two cards of an opponent's dilemma pile. Place face up beneath that mission any dilemmas that could be faced there. Replace the remaining cards in any order. Destroy this event.

name: Power Shift *VP
text: To play this event, you must command three [Rom] personnel. Plays in your core. While your [Rom] personnel is attempting a mission, you may lose 5 points to make each of your [Rom] personnel attributes +1 until the end of this mission attempt.

name: Unimatrix Zero *VP
text: To play this event, you must command three [Bor] personnel. When you play this event, for each unique Borg personnel you command, this event is cost -1. Plays in your core. You may spend an additional counter each turn. Each unique personnel you command gains [AU].

name: Covenant *VP
text: When your [Baj] Treachery personnel is facing a dilemma, remove a [Baj] personnel in your discard pile from the game to make that Treachery personnel gain all skills and attributes on that [Baj] personnel removed from the game until the end of this mission attempt.

name: Fitting In *VP
text: When your personnel is facing a dilemma, choose one for him or her to gain until the end of that dilemma: an attribute from a [Fut] personnel present; or a skill from a [Pa] personnel present.

name: Arik Soong Father of Many *VP
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, if you are about to lose command of one of your Genetically Enhanced personnel present, you may stop this personnel instead.

name: Elim Garak Agent of the Obsidian Order *VP
text: While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may discard a personnel from hand to give him one of the discarded personnel's skills until the end of that mission attempt.

name: Adopted Authority
text: Randomly select a personnel. Unless that personnel has an attribute<5, he or she and a second randomly selected personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile. Otherwise, he or she is stopped.

name: Artificial Ability
text: Your opponent names an attribute (Integrity, Cunning, or Strength). Each personnel with that attribute>7 is stopped.

name: Cadet Review
text: Each personnel may use no more than one skill while facing this dilemma. Unless you have Engineer, Medical, Science, and Security or Diplomacy, Officer, Programming, and Transporters, your opponent chooses two [Stf] personnel to be stopped.

name: Challenging Revision
text: Your opponent names a card type. Each player reveals his or her hand, places all revealed cards of that type under his or her deck, and draws an equal number of cards. When this dilemma is overcome, if it was prevented, your opponent may choose one of your personnel involved in the mission attempt to be killed.

name: Identity Theft
text: Your opponent names a card. If you have one copy of that card in your discard pile, choose a personnel to be stopped. If you have a second copy of that card in your discard pile, randomly select a personnel to be killed. If you have a third copy of that card in your discard pile, all your personnel are stopped.

name: Incorporeal Parasite
text: Your opponent names a number. If you have 4 or more personnel who have a cost equal to that number, choose one: randomly select two of those personnel to be killed; or all of those personnel are stopped. Otherwise, randomly select a personnel with a cost equal to that number to be stopped.

name: Inquest
text: Randomly select personnel until their total number of [SD] icons is 8 or more. Those personnel are stopped.

name: Soul Searching
text: Place this dilemma in your core. Randomly select a personnel and place him or her on this dilemma. At the start of your turn, you may place the personnel on this dilemma at your headquarters mission and place this dilemma under your non-headquarters mission. If you do, the dilemma's owner scores 5 points.

name: Staffing Shortage
text: Randomly select a personnel. Unless that personnel has 2 levels of a skill, that personnel is killed. Otherwise, he or she is stopped.

name: Stone-cold Bluff
text: Choose up to two personnel to be stopped. If no personnel were stopped by this dilemma, this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile. If two personnel were stopped by this dilemma, return the next dilemma in the dilemma stack to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Terminal Resignation
text: Choose a Commander that corresponds with your ship that is at this mission to be killed. If no personnel were killed by this dilemma, your opponent chooses two personnel to be stopped.

name: The Needs of the Few
text: Your opponent chooses an Engineer or Security personnel to be stopped. If you command a completed planet mission, that personnel is killed.

name: The Needs of the Many
text: Randomly select a personnel who has [Cmd] or Science to be killed. Then, reveal your hand and choose a personnel to be stopped for each interrupt revealed.

name: Tormented Dreams
text: For each of your other missions where you command unstopped personnel, your opponent chooses a personnel to be stopped. If no personnel were stopped by this dilemma, return it to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Upstaged
text: Choose two personnel. While facing the next dilemma revealed during this mission attempt, those personnel cannot be selected and cannot use their abilities, attributes, or skills.

name: War Games
text: Your opponent chooses one of his or her completed missions. Unless you have the skills needed to complete that mission, all your personnel are stopped.

name: Augmentation
text: To play this event, you must command a Genetically Enhanced personnel. Plays in your core. Name a personnel (except an Android or a Hologram). Each personnel you own with that card title gains Genetically Enhanced.

keywords: Replicate - Discard a Thief personnel from hand.
name: Coordinated Larceny
text: Stop your two Thief personnel present together to take a card from your {Display of Wealth} and place it on top of its owner's deck. Destroy this event.

name: Display of Wealth
text: To play this event, you must command six Thief personnel. Plays in your core. At the start of your turn, if there are six cards on this event, score 5 points. When you are about to lose command of this event, you may place a card from this event in its owner's discard pile to prevent that. Order - Place a card you command but do not own on this event. (You no longer command that card.)

name: Ill-gotten Gains
text: To play this event, you must command a Thief personnel. Plays in your core. When you take command of a card you do not own, you may draw a card.

name: Indelicate Repairs
text: Reveal your hand. If you revealed four or more cards, choose an opponent to choose two of those cards. You may discard the chosen cards to draw cards until you have seven cards in hand. Destroy this event.

name: Organized Crime
text: To play this event, you must command six Thief personnel. Take command of an event that has no cards on it in an opponent's core. (Move that event to your core.) If that events costs 3 or more, that opponent scores 5 points. Destroy this event.

name: Portent
text: Plays in your core. When personnel that the player on your right commands begin a mission attempt, you may examine the top card of your dilemma pile, then place it on the top or bottom of your dilemma pile.

name: Security Precautions
text: Plays in your core. Players may only score points from non-headquarters missions. When a player scores points from a mission, he or she cannot score more than the printed value of that mission. At the start of your turn, place the top card of your deck on this event. When this event is destroyed, remove it from the game.

name: Tactical Advantage
text: Plays in your core. When you win an engagement involving your [Rom] ship, choose one (or choose two if the losing ship was [Fed]): return an event in an opponent's core to its owner's hand; examine an opponent's hand and choose a non-ship card to be discarded; or remove a card in an opponent's discard pile from the game.

name: To Rule in Hell
text: To play this event, you cannot command a headquarters mission. Plays on your {Ceti Alpha V}. When a card instructs you to place a personnel on your headquarters mission, that personnel may be placed at this mission. When you command four completed [AQ] planet missions and have 120 or more points, you win the game. You may play [NA] Genetically Enhanced personnel and equipment at this mission.

name: Waken Superior Sleeper
text: Choose one: download a [Pa] Genetically Enhanced personnel, or take a [Pa] Genetically Enhanced personnel from your discard pile and place him or her on the bottom of his or her owner's deck. Then, if you command {Khan Noonien Singh}, you may shuffle this event into your deck. Otherwise, destroy this event.

name: Ambitious Intellect
text: To play this interrupt, discard a Genetically Enhanced personnel from hand. When an opponent's dilemma is about to be returned to its owner's dilemma pile during your mission attempt, remove that dilemma from the game. Order - Place a captive you command on your headquarters mission.

name: Deleted Subroutines
text: When your Hologram is facing a dilemma, discard a card from hand to choose one: you may meet Integrity requirements of that dilemma with Cunning; or name a skill that Hologram has to make that Hologram and each Hologram present lose that skill until the end of the dilemma.

name: Left with No Choice
text: To play this interrupt, kill your non-[Voy] personnel aboard your {U.S.S. Equinox}. While your [Voy] Treachery personnel is facing a dilemma, take a Nucleogenic card from your discard pile into hand. Order - Take a [Voy] Treachery personnel from your discard pile and place him or her on top of his or her owner's deck.

name: Pooling Resources
text: Order - Download {Display of Wealth}. Order - Discard a Crime card from hand to randomly select a non-ship card from an opponent's hand and place it on your Display of Wealth.

name: Signs of Sentience
text: To play this interrupt, stop your Android and your non-Android present together. Order - Take an Android from your discard pile and place it on the bottom of its owner's deck. Order - Reveal your hand to destroy an event that costs less than the number of Androids revealed.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Fed]) may attempt this mission.
name: Ariannus Passage Loot Adrift Vessel
skills: 2 Acquisition, Biology, Engineer, 2 Treachery, and Cunning>38
text: When your personnel complete this mission, you may randomly select three non-ship cards from an opponent's hand and place them on your {Display of Wealth}.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: B'omar Sovereignty Traverse Restricted Space
skills: Astrometrics, 2 Diplomacy, Honor, Navigation, and Integrity>34
text: Players may not play more than one copy of the same event or interrupt each turn.

name: Ceti Alpha V Forge Settlement
skills: Biology, Geology, Leadership, Medical, and Cunning>34
text: Cards an opponent owns cannot prevent or destroy copies of {To Rule in Hell} you own. At the start of your turn, you may discard a card from hand to download To Rule in Hell.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Rigel X Locate Mysterious Contact
skills: Anthropology, Diplomacy, Leadership, Security, and Cunning>34
text: When six or more personnel begin a mission attempt here, you may draw two cards. If you do, your opponent may draw one extra dilemma and spend one extra in total cost on dilemmas.

name: Torga IV Strained Negotiations
skills: Anthropology, Diplomacy, Officer, and (Honor and Integrity>34 or Strength>34 and a Vorta)
text: When your personnel complete this mission, choose one: each player scores 5 points; or each player loses 5 points.

name: Brian Evethers
text: When you play this personnel, each player may look through his or her deck for an equipment, event, or interrupt. Reveal all such cards at the same time. Discard any cards whose card type was also revealed by another player. All remaining cards are placed in their owner's hand, then each player shuffles his or her deck.

name: Dala Con Artist
text: When this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may take a personnel on your {Display of Wealth} and place him or her in his or her owner's discard pile to make this personnel gain each skill that personnel has until the end of the dilemma.

name: Icheb Genetic Weapon
text: While you command but do not own this personnel, place all [Bor] personnel at this mission in their owner's discard pile.

name: Joaquin Superhuman Lieutenant
text: Order - If you do not command a ship and have completed {Ceti Alpha V}, you may take a ship from any player's discard pile and place it at this mission. You now command that ship (it becomes [NA].) You may do this only once each turn.

name: Kati
text: When you play this personnel, if you command {Khan Noonien Singh}, she is cost -2.

name: Marla McGivers Superior Woman
text: While you command {Khan Noonien Singh}, you may play this personnel at cost -1 to {Ceti Alpha V}. Order - Stop this personnel and your [Pa] Genetically Enhanced personnel present to draw a card.

name: McPherson
text: When you play this personnel, if you command {Khan Noonien Singh}, he is cost -2.

name: Mobar
text: When you play this personnel, you may randomly select a non-ship card from an opponent's hand and place it on your {Display of Wealth}.

name: One One Efficiency Expert
text: When you play this personnel, you may discard a random card from hand to download {Zero Zero}. When you spend 1 counter to draw a card, if this personnel is aboard your ship, you may stop this personnel and remove that card from the game to draw a card.

name: Otto
text: When you play this personnel, if you command {Khan Noonien Singh}, he is cost -2.

name: Sobi Felicium Dealer
text: When you play this personnel, you may examine the top four cards of your deck. You may take one card into hand for each different Commodity in your core, then place the remaining cards on the bottom of your deck in any order.

name: T'Jon Felicium Addict
text: While you command {Felicium}, this personnel is Cunning +2 and Strength +2 and gains [Cmd], Acquisition, Leadership, and Navigation. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may stop him to take command of a {Felicium} you own in an opponent's core.

name: Udar "Smike"
text: While this personnel is on a planet or aboard a ship, you may play {Arik Soong} on that planet or ship. When this personnel is facing a dilemma, if your [NA] Genetically Enhanced personnel present is selected, you may replace him or her with this personnel.

name: Yuta Last of Her Line
text: Order - Name a number and place this personnel in her owner's discard pile to kill an opponent's personnel present with total printed attributes equal to that number.

name: Zero Zero Efficiency Expert
text: When you play this personnel, you may discard a random card from hand to download {One One}. When you have drawn dilemmas, if this personnel is aboard your ship, you may stop this personnel and remove a dilemma you have drawn from the game to draw an additional dilemma.

name: Combat Vessel Heavily Armed
text: To staff this ship, you must have three {Thief} personnel aboard. Order - If this ship is staffed and at an opponent's mission, discard a Crime card from hand to take an equipment, event, or interrupt from that opponent's discard pile and place it on your {Display of Wealth}.

name: Translocation Raider
text: When an engagement involving your ship with your {Thief} aboard begins at this mission, you may discard a Crime card from hand to have this ship join that engagement. When you win an engagement involving this ship, you may randomly select a non-ship card from the loser's hand and place it on your {Display of Wealth}.

name: Khan Noonien Singh Bold Man *VP
text: This personnel is the corresponding Commander of your unique ship that he is aboard.

name: Artificial Ability *VP
text: Your opponent names an attribute (Integrity, Cunning, or Strength). Each personnel with that attribute>7 is stopped.

name: Julian Bashir Rebel Captain *VP
skills: Biology Exobiology Leadership Medical Officer Science
text: When you play this personnel, choose an opponent. For each headquarters mission he or she commands, this personnel is cost -3.

name: Sylvia *VP
text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost -1 (-2 for each Decay event). Unless you have 2 Leadership, Officer, Security, and Cunning>38 or 2 Engineer, Programming, and 2 Science, randomly select two personnel to be placed in your opponent's brig.

name: Unbelievable Emergency *VP
text: Your opponent names a skill. For each headquarters mission you command, randomly select two personnel to be stopped. If either of those personnel that is selected has the named skill, kill that personnel instead.

name: Mission Accomplished *VP
text: Plays in your core. When you complete a mission, if you command a staffed ship at that mission with its Commander aboard, score 5 points.

name: The New Resistance *VP
text: To play this event, your opponent must command a ship at a non-headquarters mission. Plays in your core. When you play a Dissident personnel, you may reveal the top card of your deck. If it is a Dissident, you may play him or her at cost -3.

name: The Central Command *VP
text: When any number of your [Car] Officer and/or [Car] Treachery personnel are about to be stopped by a dilemma, discard the top three cards of your deck to prevent that.

name: Bareil Antos Esteemed Vedek *VP
skills: Anthropology Biology 2 Diplomacy 2 Honor Leadership Science
text: Each of your other [Baj] personnel present is Integrity +1 (or +2 while facing a dilemma).

name: Data Lucasian Chair *VP
skills: 2 Astrometrics Engineer Exobiology Physics Programming 2 Science
text: When you play this personnel, if you have completed a mission requiring Diplomacy or Leadership, he is cost -4.

name: Jean-Luc Picard Galen *VP
text: While an artifact is in your discard pile, each of your {Smuggler} personnel and {Thief} personnel is attributes +1.

name: Silik Chameleon *VP
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a random card from hand to make him gain a skill that is required by that dilemma until the end of this turn. You may do this only once each turn.

name: The Dal'Rok *VP
text: Unless your personnel have a total cost>17, for each headquarters mission you command, randomly select a personnel to be killed and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Opaka Healer *VP
text: While this personnel is attempting a [GQ] mission, each Kai, Prylar, and Vedek at that mission may meet Cunning and Strength requirements of that mission using Integrity.

name: Chained Environment
text: Unless you have 2 Diplomacy and 2 Geology or Cunning>36, all your personnel are stopped and, if there are no other dilemmas on this mission, place this dilemma on this mission. Add Science to each of this mission's requirements.

name: Chula: The Game
text: Place this dilemma on this mission. When your personnel are about to face a dilemma whose title begins with "Chula" here, randomly select one of your personnel attempting this mission to be stopped. When your personnel complete this mission, this dilemma is overcome.

name: Chula: Trickery
text: Randomly select three personnel. Unless those personnel have 2 Officer or twelve different skills, all three are stopped.

name: Discommendation
text: Randomly select three personnel. If any of those personnel is a [Kli] personnel, they are all stopped. Otherwise, choose one of those personnel to be stopped.

name: Legal Inflexibility
text: Unless you have 2 Transporters and Strength>32 or Law and Cunning>32, all your personnel are stopped. When this dilemma is overcome, if it was prevented, your opponent may choose one of your personnel involved in the mission attempt to be placed in your opponent's brig.

name: Nonlinear Existence
text: Your opponent chooses a card in his or her discard pile. Unless you discard a card from hand of the same card type, randomly select a personnel to be stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Pawn Against Pawn
text: Your opponent returns a random personnel in his or her discard pile to his or her owner's hand. Unless you have the skills on that personnel, all your personnel are stopped.

name: "Rapid Progress"
text: Your opponent removes any number of cards from his or her discard pile from the game and names a different skill (except Acquisition, Intelligence, Law, or Telepathy) for each different card type removed. Unless you have those skills, all your personnel are stopped.

name: Rejecting the Past
text: This dilemma is cost +1 for each card in opponent's discard pile (limit 6). Randomly select two personnel to be stopped.

name: The Nth Degree
text: Unless you have 2 Engineer and 2 Leadership or Cunning>36, all your personnel are stopped and, if there are no other dilemmas on this mission, place this dilemma on this mission. Add Science to each of this mission's requirements.

name: Orb of Contemplation
text: When your personnel present is about to be stopped or killed by a dilemma, if you have a copy of him or her in your discard pile, you may return this equipment to its owner's hand to prevent that.

name: Orb of Prophecy and Change
text: When your personnel present begin a mission attempt, you may exchange a personnel present with a personnel of the same affiliation in your discard pile if both of them could be played at the same headquarters mission you command. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Orb of Time
text: When your personnel present is facing a dilemma with a cost of 3 or more that does not require a skill, you may destroy this equipment to place the top card of the opponent on your left's dilemma pile beneath this mission.

name: Clandestine Kidnapping
text: To play this event, you must command three [Dom] personnel. Choose a personnel in an opponent's discard pile that he or she does not command. Place that personnel in your brig. (That personnel's owner now commands him or her.) Remove this event from the game.

name: Cutting the Strings
text: To play this event, you must command {Bajor}. Choose one: destroy an event on your mission; or return a dilemma on your mission to its owner's dilemma pile. Destroy this event.

name: Planned Provocation
text: To play this event, you must command three [Rom] personnel. Choose an opponent to discard the top card of his or her deck. If that card was an event or an interrupt, you may draw a card. Destroy this event.

name: Self-Replicating Roadblock
text: Plays on your non-headquarters mission (limit one per mission). When you play this event, name a dilemma or an event. The named event cannot be played on this mission. When the named dilemma is revealed here, return it to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Spiritual Exploration
text: To play this event, you must command three [Baj] personnel. Plays in your core. When you place a [Baj] personnel from your discard pile at your {Bajor}, you may destroy this event to place an additional [Baj] personnel from your discard pile at your Bajor.

name: Swift Justice
text: To play this event, you must command {Cardassia Prime} and no other headquarters missions. Plays in your core. When you play a Capture card, you may draw two cards, then discard a card from hand. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Trap Is Sprung
text: To play this event, you must command three [Car] personnel. Plays on an opponent's mission with no dilemmas beneath it. When an opponent's personnel begin a mission attempt here, you may destroy this event to randomly select one of those personnel to be placed in your brig.

name: Accession
text: To play this interrupt, you must command six [Baj] personnel. When your Anthropology personnel begins a mission attempt, take a [Baj] personnel you do not command from your discard pile and place him or her present with that Anthropology personnel. (You now command him or her.) That personnel joins the mission attempt. Remove this interrupt from the game.

name: Leap of Faith
text: When your Kai, Prylar, or Vedek is randomly selected by a dilemma, if the cost of that dilemma is less than the cost of that personnel, he or she cannot be stopped by dilemmas until the end of this turn.

name: The Warrior's Anthem
text: When you win combat, if you have two or more Assault cards in your discard pile, score 5 points.

name: Bajor Blessed of the Prophets
skills: You may play [Baj] cards and equipment at this mission.
text: While you do not command another headquarters missions, you may play Artifact equipment as if you commanded a completed mission requiring Anthropology.

name: Cardassia IV Hold Secret Prisoners
text: When your personnel begin a mission attempt here, reduce the attribute requirements of this mission by 2 (limit 10) for each captive in your brig until the end of that mission attempt.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Dyson Sphere Explore Mysterious Structure
text: This mission is worth 5 more points for each different card type in your discard pile.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Kreetassa Perform Intricate Ritual
skills: Honor, Law, Officer, and Integrity>36 or Intelligence, Security, Treachery, and Strength>36
text: At the start of your first turn, you may download up to two Rituals. Place one in your core and discard the other.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Metron Arena Resolve Standing Conflict
skills: Leadership, 2 Science, and Cunning>32 or Officer, 2 Treachery, and Strength>32
text: When a card an opponent owns removes any number of non-[Bor] personnel you do not command in your discard pile from the game, place them on this mission. (You now command those personnel.)

name: Parada II Expose Security Threat
skills: Anthropology, Diplomacy, Leadership, Security, and Integrity>30
text: When your personnel complete this mission, if you have copies of two or more different personnel that each used a skill to complete this mission in your discard pile, score 10 points.

name: Sha Ka Ree Quest for Infinite Knowledge
skills: Anthropology, 2 Leadership, and (Honor and Integrity>44 or Treachery and Cunning>44)
text: When your personnel complete this mission, it is worth 10 less points unless you remove a ship in your discard pile from the game.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Starbase 718 Investigate Cryosatellite
skills: Engineer and (Leadership, Security, and Strength>32 or Medical, Science, and Cunning>32)
text: When your personnel complete this mission, you may place any number of unique personnel with a total cost of 6 or less from your discard pile at your headquarters mission where they could be played.

name: Alenis Grem Occupation Historian
text: When you play a [Baj] personnel at this mission, you may discard cards from the top of your deck equal to that personnel's cost.

name: Deela Weary Caretaker
text: When you lose 5 points during your Execute Orders segment, you may place this personnel in her owner's discard pile to score 5 points.

name: Mond
text: This personnel is attributes +2 for each copy of him in your discard pile.

name: Winn Adami Renegade Priest
text: When a card in your discard pile is removed from the game, this personnel is attributes +1 until the end of this turn (limit +6). Order - Remove an Orb or Prophet card in your discard pile from the game to draw a card.

name: Opaka Healer
text: While this personnel is attempting a [GQ] mission, each Kai, Prylar, and Vedek at that mission may meet Cunning and Strength requirements of that mission using Integrity.

name: Vengar
text: When you play this personnel, he is cost -1 for each opponent that has an interrupt in his or her discard pile.

name: Corbin Entek Inquisitor
text: This personnel is attributes +2 for each captive in your brig (limit +6).

name: Dakol Lecherous Overseer
text: When you play this personnel, the next Punishment event you play this turn is cost -2.

name: Gollek
text: When you play this personnel, she is cost -1 for each opponent that has an event in his or her discard pile.

name: Tajor
text: When you discard this personnel from the top of your deck, you may place him on your {Cardassia Prime}.

name: Yteppa Obsidian Order Asset
text: When an opponent's personnel present is killed, you may discard a Capture card from hand to place that personnel in your brig.

name: Brian Sofin
text: When you play this personnel, you may lose 5 points to draw two cards, then place your hand in your discard pile and draw an equal number of cards.

name: Julian Bashir Nostalgic Doctor
text: When your [Fut] personnel present is about to be killed by a dilemma, you may stop that personnel and discard a non-[Fut] personnel from hand to prevent that.

name: Nilz Baris Agricultural Undersecretary
text: You may play this personnel at cost +3 to remove an event (or dilemma) on your non-headquarters mission from the game.

name: Paxton Reese Stellar Cartographer
text: When this personnel uses a skill to complete a [GQ] mission, each player may download a personnel and place him or her in his or her owner's discard pile.

name: Russell Toddman Security Conscious
text: When you lose command of one of your events, you may take a [DS9] personnel you own that was on that event and place him or her at your headquarters mission where he or she could be played. (You now command that personnel.)

name: Prak
text: When you play this personnel, you may place a non-Artifact equipment from any player's discard pile on your {Ferenginar}. (You now command that equipment.)

name: Leskit Embittered Warrior
text: This personnel is Cunning +1 for each Maneuver event in your discard pile (limit +5). This personnel is Strength +1 for each Assault event in your discard pile (limit +5).

name: Orb Transport Vessel
text: This ship is attributes +1 for each of the following keywords in your discard pile: Assault, Orb, and Prophet.

name: Type III Galor
text: When you play this ship, you may discard the top three cards of your deck to make this ship cost -2.

name: Lore The One *VP
skills: Diplomacy Engineer Leadership Programming Security 2 Treachery
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, he cannot be stopped.

name: Tuvok Chief of Security *VP
skills: Anthropology Biology Honor Law Leadership Officer Security
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma that requires Officer or Security at a [DQ] mission, he is attributes +2 and gains Security.

name: Charismatic Mimic
text: Choose a personnel with 2 Acquisition or a personnel with 2 Diplomacy to be stopped. If you cannot, place this dilemma in your core.

name: Counterinsurgency Program *VP
text: Your opponent discards any number of event or equipment cards from hand and names a skill (except Acquisition, Intelligence, Law or Telepathy) for each one. Unless you have those skills, all your personnel are stopped.

name: Harsh Conditions *VP
text: For each headquarters mission you command, your opponent names a skill. Place this dilemma on this mission. While your personnel is facing a dilemma, he or she cannot use those skills. At the end of this mission attempt, this dilemma is overcome.

name: Biogenic Weapon *VP
text: To play this event, you must command two [Fed][Maq] personnel. Plays on a mission. This mission cannot be attempted unless its owner has completed each other non-headquarters mission he or she commands.

name: Holding Cell *VP
text: To play this event, you must command six [DS9] personnel. Plays in your core. When you play this event, name a personnel, then each player places each copy of that personnel they command on this event (those personnel cannot use abilities). When an opponent is about to play an interrupt, prevent that interrupt and place it on this event.

name: Rule of Acquisition #33 *VP
text: When your [Fer] personnel is facing a dilemma, say "It never hurts to suck up to the boss" to choose one - make that personnel attributes +2 until the end of the turn; or replace all levels of any one skill in that dilemma's requirements with 3 Acquisition.

name: Benjamin Sisko Command Staffer *VP
text: You may play this personnel aboard your [TOS] ship. When an opponent plays an interrupt, if this personnel is present with three [Pa] personnel, you may return this personnel to his owner's hand to prevent that interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile.

name: William T. Riker Exchange Officer *VP
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a card from hand to make him gain a skill from your Klingon present until the end of that mission attempt.

name: Miles O'Brien "Smiley" *VP
text: When you play a ship at this mission, if you have played no other ships this turn, it is cost -1 for each of your Engineer personnel at this mission.

name: U.S.S. Relativity Federation Timeship *VP
text: At the start of each of your turns, place each non-[Fut] personnel you command in his or her owner's discard pile. You may play [Fut][Fed] personnel and equipment aboard this ship. When a card instructs you to place this ship at your headquarters mission, you may place it at your [Fed] space mission.

name: Spock Man of Integrity *VP
text: While you command an [AU] personnel, you may play this personnel at cost +2 to make each player place a personnel from hand on a headquarters mission where that personnel could be played.

name: The Weak Will Perish *VP
text: Randomly select a personnel. Unless that personnel has Telepathy or Strength>6, place this dilemma in your core. That personnel is killed.

name: Artistic License
text: Choose a number of personnel to be stopped equal to the number of different dilemmas beneath this mission.

name: Commanding Presence
text: Unless you have 3 Security or 2 Navigation and Cunning>30 or a personnel with 2 Honor, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed in your core.

name: Dubious Decoy
text: Choose a personnel with 2 Transporters or a personnel with 2 Treachery to be stopped. If you cannot, place this dilemma in your core.

name: Flare of Rage
text: For each Persistent dilemma beneath this mission, this dilemma is cost -1. Unless you have Anthropology, Medical, 2 Security, and Strength>35 or 2 Archaeology, Transporters, and 2 Treachery, randomly select two personnel to be removed from the game.

name: Frozen by Fear
text: For each Persistent dilemma beneath this mission, this dilemma is cost -1. Unless you have 2 Honor, Law, Medical, and Cunning>35 or Officer, 2 Science, and 2 Treachery, randomly select two personnel to be removed from the game.

name: Generous Offer
text: When your opponent reveals this dilemma, he or she may give you command of his or her Commodity to add 10 to each of this dilemma's attribute requirements. Unless you have Archaeology and Cunning>30 or Diplomacy and Strength>30, all your personnel are stopped.

name: On Guard
text: Choose a personnel with 2 Honor or a personnel with 2 Security to be stopped. If you cannot, place this dilemma in your core.

name: Peremptory Plea
text: Choose a personnel who has Biology to be stopped. The next dilemma revealed during this mission attempt is cost -1 for each Genetically Enhanced personnel the opponent on your left commands.

name: Pest Control
text: Unless you have 2 Engineer and 2 Exobiology or Transporters, 2 Treachery, and Cunning>34, randomly select two personnel to be stopped and place this dilemma in your core. At the start of each of your turns, discard the top card of your deck.

name: Unconventional Consideration
text: Choose a personnel who has Acquisition or Intelligence or Law or Telepathy to be stopped. If you cannot, all your personnel are stopped.

name: The Weak Will Perish
text: Randomly select a personnel. Unless that personnel has Telepathy or Strength>6, place this dilemma in your core. That personnel is killed.

name: Unusual Simulacrum
text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Each personnel facing a Species 8472 dilemma here cannot gain skills. At the end of this turn, if this mission is not complete, place this dilemma in your core. Otherwise, it is overcome.

name: Combined Attack
text: Search your dilemma pile for a Species 8472 dilemma and place it in the opponent on your right's core, then shuffle and replace your dilemma pile. Remove this event from the game.

name: Hollow Hospitality
text: Plays in your core. Your non-Treachery personnel cannot gain skills (except Treachery). Each of your [DS9] personnel and [E] personnel are Strength +1.

name: Launch Orders
text: To play this event, you must command two Admirals. Reveal the top five cards of your deck. Separate them into two face-up piles. The opponent on your left chooses one pile for you to take into your hand; discard the other pile. Destroy this event.

name: Martial Law
text: Plays in your core. Your ships may not move to or from {Earth}. Order - Stop your [Fed][DS9] personnel at your Earth to draw a card (limit three per turn).

name: Peaceful Coexistence
text: Plays in your core. Each unique non-Bluegill [TNG] personnel you own (except Androids and Holograms) gains Bluegill. Each of your Bluegill personnel are Integrity -1 and Strength +1.

name: Power Loss
text: Plays in your core. You may only begin one mission attempt each turn. Order - Stop your [E] Treachery personnel to unstop each of your stopped [DS9] personnel. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Strength in Numbers
text: To play this event, you must command three [Bor] personnel. Plays in your core. When you return a Persistent dilemma to your dilemma pile from beneath an opponent's completed mission, stop each of that opponent's personnel at that mission.

name: Undermined Defenses
text: Plays in your core. While your [TN] personnel is facing a dilemma, if an opponent owns ten or more dilemmas that have been removed from the game, you may discard the top card of your deck to exclude that personnel from random selections until the end of that dilemma.

name: Vacuum-Desiccated Remains
text: While you command but do not own this event, each player's Ferengi gain [Pa].

name: War of Attrition
text: To play this event, you must command three [Dom][TN] personnel. Plays in your core. At the start of each player's turn, he or she removes the top card of his or her dilemma pile from the game.

name: Frantic Probe
text: When you have drawn dilemmas, you may remove one or more of those dilemmas from the game to draw an additional dilemma. Order - If the opponent on your left commands a completed mission, search your dilemma pile for up to three copies of a dilemma and remove them from the game. Shuffle and replace your dilemma pile.

name: Paralyzing Procedure
text: To play this interrupt, you must command three [TN] Dissident personnel. When your opponent downloads any number of non-ship cards, shuffle them into his or her deck.

name: Untapped Influence
text: While your [TN] personnel is facing a dilemma, choose a dilemma an opponent owns that has been removed from the game. That personnel may gain a skill required by that dilemma or add that dilemma's cost to his or her attributes until the end of the mission attempt.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Northwest Passage Contact Extradimensional Species
text: At the end of your turn, if this mission is complete, you may search your dilemma pile for a Species 8472 dilemma and place it in the opponent on your right's core, then shuffle and replace your dilemma pile.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Terrasphere 8 Starfleet Command Re-creation
text: At the start of your turn, if this mission is complete and the opponent on your right has eight or more {Species 8472} dilemmas in his or her core, you win the game.

name: Kira Nerys Grudging Ally
text: When you play this personnel, you may remove a [TN] card in your discard pile from the game to remove the top card of an opponent's dilemma pile from the game. You may spend additional counters this turn equal to the cost of that dilemma.

name: Nasin Following Orders
text: When your non-Jem'Hadar present is randomly selected by a dilemma, you may remove a [TN] card in your discard pile from the game to replace him or her with your Jem'Hadar present.

name: Revok Eager Ally
text: When this personnel uses a skill to complete a mission, discard the top three cards of your deck to remove the top two cards of an opponent's dilemma pile from the game. You may do this only once each mission attempt.

name: Edan'Atal
text: The highest cost dilemma an opponent owns that has been removed from the game has that dilemma's cost added to this personnel's attributes.

name: Founder Leader Intergalactic Warlord
text: When you play this personnel, she is cost -1 for each dilemma an opponent owns that has been removed from the game.

name: Rayva Bureaucratic Ally
text: When this personnel uses a skill to complete a mission, each player removes the top two cards of his or her dilemma pile from the game. You may do this only once each mission attempt.

name: Benjamin Sisko Acting Head of Starfleet Security
skills: Diplomacy Engineer Honor Leadership Officer 2 Security
text: While you command a Paranoia event, each of your [Fed] Security personnel present is attributes +1.

name: Dexter Remmick Alien Thrall
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, if he is present with three or more Bluegill personnel, he cannot be placed in an opponent's brig or stopped.

name: Gregory Quinn Alien Courier
text: When your Bluegill personnel present is about to be killed, you may stop that personnel and discard a Bluegill personnel from hand to prevent that.

name: Harry Kim Diligent Ensign
text: Order - If you command four [DQ] space missions and this personnel is aboard your [Voy] ship, return him to his owner's hand to place that ship at one of those missions.

name: Karen Loews Patient Chaperone
text: When you play this personnel, you may place a [Fed] Genetically Enhanced personnel from hand at this mission.

name: Leyton Suspicious Executive
text: When this personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may discard a Paranoia card from hand to prevent that.

name: Oq'nab Academy Commandant
text: While this personnel is an eligible target for a random selection, you may discard a Paranoia card from hand to exclude him and an [E] personnel present from that selection.

name: Sparber
text: When you play this personnel, choose an event with no cards on it in a player's core. That event loses all of its game text (except keywords) until the end of this turn.

name: Anij Eupneic Explorer
text: When you play this personnel, you may download {Heightened Perception}.

name: Kivas Fajo Hoarder
text: When you play this personnel, you may download {Greed}. This personnel is Cunning +1 and Strength +1 for each dilemma you own in an opponent's core (limit +5).

name: Morn Silent Partner
text: At the start of your turn, if this personnel and your other Dissident are at {Mouth of the Wormhole}, each opponent discards the top card of his or her deck.

name: Friendly Fire
text: For each of your headquarters missions, randomly select a personnel to be killed. You may discard two events from hand to prevent this.

name: Historical Curiosity
text: Unless you have Anthropology, Law, and Transporters or Shields>8, randomly select two personnel to be stopped and your opponent draws up to two cards.

name: Varon-T Disruptor
text: When combat begins involving your personnel present, the opponent's personnel involved who has the highest Integrity is killed.

name: Dedication Plaque
text: Plays on your ship (limit one per ship). While you have this ship's Commander aboard, it is Weapons +2 and Shields +2.

name: Second Edition
text: Download a copy of a personnel you command. If that personnel is an [AU] personnel, draw a card. Destroy this event.

name: Split Second
text: Plays in your core. Dilemmas cannot be prevented (and cannot be overcome by "prevent and overcome" effects). When any player completes a mission, destroy this event.

name: Shrouded in Light
text: To play this interrupt, you must command {Founders' Homeworld}. While your Jem'Hadar is facing a dilemma, you may exclude him from random selections until the end of that dilemma.

name: Wolf 359 Last Stand
skills: Engineer, Honor, Officer, Cunning>32, and total Weapons at this mission>10
text: This mission is worth 15 fewer points for each other mission you have completed. When your personnel complete this mission, destroy each of your ships at this mission.

name: Odo Surreptitious Ally
text: Order - Discard a Paranoia card from hand to take a [E] card from your discard pile into hand. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Ayala Patriot
text: When an opponent places a card on top of his or her deck, you may stop this personnel to place that card on the bottom of his or her deck.

name: Declan Keogh Veteran Captain
text: While this personnel is aboard your ship at a [GQ] mission, each of your non-unique [DS9] personnel present is attributes +1.

name: Lon Suder Casual Killer
text: Order - Kill a [Voy] personnel present aboard your ship to draw cards equal to the cost of that personnel. Place this personnel in his owner's discard pile.

name: Sito Jaxa Undercover "Terrorist"
text: When this personnel is about to be captured or killed, you may take a [TNG] card from your discard pile into hand.

name: Neelix Grand Proxy
text: When your [Fer] Leadership personnel present is randomly selected by a dilemma, you may replace him or her with this personnel.

name: Falow Gamemaster
text: When you play this personnel, you may search your dilemma pile for a dilemma whose title begins with "Chula" and set it aside. Shuffle and replace your dilemma pile and place that dilemma on top of your dilemma pile.

name: Sarin Charmer
text: When you play a Replicate event, you may kill this personnel to put that event in your hand instead of destroying it.

name: Henry Archer Trailblazing Engineer
text: Order - Discard a [SF] ship from hand to draw up to two cards. You may do this only once each turn.

name: U.S.S. Odyssey Gamma Quadrant Vanguard
text: While this ship is at a [GQ] mission, your {Danube-class ships} are attributes +1 and you may play them at cost -1.

name: Seven of Nine Notorious Scapegoat
text: At the start of your turn, you may place a [NA] card from hand on the bottom of your deck.

name: Moral Choice *VP
text: Randomly select three personnel. If any of those personnel is a [Fed] personnel, they are all stopped. Otherwise, choose one of those personnel to be stopped.

name: Temptation *VP
text: Randomly select three personnel. Each of those personnel that does not have Honor or Treachery is stopped.

name: Endangered *VP
text: Plays in your core. When the player on your right begins a mission attempt, you may lose 5 points and destroy this event to draw three extra dilemmas and spend three extra in total cost on dilemmas.

name: Rescue Captives *VP
text: Discard any number of cards from hand to take an equal number of your personnel from your opponents' brigs and place them on your headquarters mission. Destroy this event.

name: Jadzia Dax Elder *VP
text: When you play this personnel, for each Vedek you command, she is cost -1.

name: Borg Queen Bringer of Order *VP
text: Order - Discard the top card of your deck to name a skill. Each of your Borg gains that skill. This effect lasts until the end of this turn. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Remata'Klan Unit Leader *VP
text: When this personnel is an eligible target for a random selection, you may exclude another [Dom] personnel present from that selection.

name: Beverly Crusher Captain Picard *VP
text: While this personnel is attempting a mission worth 40 or more points, she is attributes +1 and gains Medical.

name: Leonard H. McCoy Remarkable Man *VP
text: While this personnel is attempting a mission, if you have completed no missions, each of your personnel present is attributes +2.

name: Chula: The Chandra *VP
text: Randomly select a personnel. Repeat this until you select a personnel with a cost equal to or greater than the first personnel that you selected. Stop each selected personnel.

name: Common Purpose *VP
text: Stop any number of your personnel, then count the number of different affiliation among those personnel. Spend that many additional counters this turn. Remove this event from the game.

name: Abrasive Allies
text: Unless you command personnel with more different affiliations than the owner of this dilemma, your opponent chooses a personnel to be stopped.

name: Dramatis Personae
text: Unless you have 2 Medical and 2 Science or 2 Archaeology and Transporters, your opponent chooses one: kill the personnel with the fewest [SD]; or, kill the personnel with the lowest total attributes.

name: Indecent Proposal
text: Randomly select a personnel who costs 5 or more to be stopped. If you cannot, your opponent chooses a personnel to be stopped. If a personnel who costs 5 or more was stopped by this dilemma, return this dilemma to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Mutinous Guests
text: Unless you have 3 Security or 2 Vulcans, all your personnel are stopped and your opponent may place a ship at this mission at your planet mission.

name: Precarious Position
text: Unless you have 2 Engineer and Officer or Science and Cunning>40, randomly select a personnel to be killed and your opponent may destroy up to two events in your core.

name: Coil Spanner
text: While at a [GQ] space mission, each of your Officer personnel present gain Astrometrics and Navigation.

name: Hyperspanner
text: While at a [GQ] planet mission, each of your Engineer personnel present gain Anthropology and Geology.

name: Kar'takin
text: When you win combat in which all your personnel involved are Jem'Hadar, if this equipment is present, you may place this equipment on the bottom of its owner's deck to randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved.

name: Common Cause
text: Count the number of different affiliations among your personnel, then draw that many cards. Destroy this event.

name: Common Purpose
text: Stop any number of your personnel, then count the number of different affiliations among those personnel. Spend that many additional counters this turn. Remove this event from the game.

name: Expedient Opportunity
text: Plays in your core. When a ship is about to move between missions in different quadrants, do not add 2 to the span total of those missions.

name: Field Report
text: To play this event, you must command three [DS9] personnel. Plays on your [GQ] mission. When a dilemma at this mission is about to return to its owner's dilemma pile, you may destroy this event to prevent that and place that dilemma beneath this mission.

name: Karemman Fleece
text: To play this event, you must command three [Dom] personnel. While you command but do not own this event, you have one fewer counter to spend during each of your Play and Draw Cards segments.

name: Mobilization Points
text: To play this event, you must command three [Dom] personnel. Plays in your core. The first unique Jem'Hadar played each turn is cost -1.

name: Profound Discovery
text: To play this event, you must command three non-[Bor] Archaeology personnel. Place a non-[Bor] Archaeology personnel from hand who costs 3 or less on your headquarters mission. Destroy this event.

name: Rule of Acquisition #75
text: Plays in your core. When your [Fer] personnel begins a mission attempt at a [GQ] mission, you may give command of your Commodity event to an opponent.

name: Spiteful Strategy
text: To play this event, you must command three [Dom] personnel. Plays in your core. When an event is played, it is cost +1.

name: The Die Is Cast
text: Plays in your core. When your [Car] personnel or [Rom] personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma at a [GQ] mission, you may discard the top two cards of your deck (or an event from hand) to prevent that. You may do this only once each dilemma.

name: Unproven Suspicions
text: To play this event, you must command three [E] personnel. Plays in your core. When an event is played, you may destroy this event to prevent that event and place it in its owner's discard pile. That event's owner may spend 2 counters to prevent this.

name: A Day Long Remembered
text: When your [Kli] personnel is attempting a non-[AQ] mission, he or she is attributes +1 for each Assault or Maneuver event in your core until the end of that mission attempt (limit +5).

name: Ancient Grudge
text: When an opponent plays an event, that opponent chooses a [Baj] personnel in your discard pile. (If that event costs 3 or more, he or she chooses an additional [Baj] personnel.) Remove the chosen personnel in your discard pile from the game to prevent that event.

name: Common Enemy
text: While your personnel is facing a dilemma, count the number of different affiliations among your personnel present. He or she is attributes +1 for each affiliation counted until the end of this mission attempt (limit +8).

name: Crippling Strike
text: To play this interrupt, you must command three [Dom] personnel. When your opponent's ship is about to move, it is Range -5 until the end of the turn. That opponent may discard five cards from hand to prevent this.

name: Inevitable Triumph
text: To play this interrupt, you must command three [TN] personnel. When an opponent plays an event he or she must choose: prevent that event, or remove the top two dilemmas of his or her dilemma pile from the game.

name: Invasive Transporters
text: Order - Place any number of your Jem'Hadar and equipment at a mission aboard a ship at the same mission. Place this interrupt on the bottom of its owner's deck.

name: Founders' Homeworld Contingent Refuge
skills: You may play [Dom] cards and equipment at this mission.
text: When you complete a [GQ] mission, if you do not command another headquarters mission, each opponent loses 5 points.

name: Kar-telos Asteroid Belt Salvage Wreckage
text: When your personnel complete this mission, you may download a non-unique Jem'Hadar, then place him on your ship at this mission.

name: Loren III Combined Discovery
skills: Archaeology, Astrometrics, Diplomacy, Officer, and Cunning>34
text: While you command an Archaeology Commander aboard his or her corresponding ship, you may play an Archaeology Commander of an affiliation you do not command aboard.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Stakoron II Mine Miszinite
skills: Anthropology, 2 Engineer, Geology, and (Cunning>38 or Strength>42)
text: The first dual dilemma revealed here each turn is cost +1.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Stakoron Strait Patrol Shipping Lane
skills: Astrometrics, Navigation, 2 Officer, and (Cunning>38 or Strength>42)
text: The first dual dilemma revealed here each turn is cost +1.

name: Keiko O'Brien Pah-Wraith Hostage
text: When this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a card from hand to make a [Fed][DS9] personnel present gain Anthropology, Exobiology, and Treachery until the end of that dilemma. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Rase Norvan
text: When you play this personnel, you may take a [Fed] card from your discard pile into hand.

name: Sarish Rez Ministerial Adjutant
text: When you play this personnel, the next [Fed][DS9] personnel you play this turn is cost -2.

name: Kira Founder Curious
text: When an opponent's personnel begins a mission attempt, if this personnel is in your hand and you command {Founders' Homeworld}, you may place her persent with that opponent's personnel. (You now command this personnel.)

name: Liam Bilby Unwitting Accomplice
text: Order - Kill this personnel to kill an opponent's non-[Dom] personnel present.

name: Toman'torax Obstinate Second
text: When you win combat involving this personnel, if he is equipped with a Hand Weapon, randomly select an opponent's personnel involved in that combat to be killed.

name: Virak'kara
text: This personnel is attributes +2 for each Hand Weapon present (limit +6).

name: Benjamin Sisko Enlightened Supervisor
text: While this personnel is present with your [Baj] personnel, each of your [Fed] personnel present is attributes +1.

name: Elizabeth Lense Valedictorian
text: When you play this personnel, the next [Baj][DS9] personnel you play this turn is cost -2.

name: Lojal Investigative Ambassador
text: When you play this personnel, you may lose 5 points to take up to two [Baj] personnel from your discard pile and place them on your headquarters mission where they could be played.

name: Lwaxana Troi Extraordinary Ambassador
text: When you play this personnel, she is cost -1 for each non-[Fed] personnel you command.

name: Quark Opportunistic Envoy
text: You may play this personnel aboard your [Dom] ship. When you play this personnel, you may download {Tulaberry Wine} and give command of that event to an opponent.

name: Martok Welcome Presence
text: When this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard an interrupt from hand to make him gain all skills and attributes on a [DS9] personnel in your discard pile until the end of that dilemma. You may do this only once each turn.

name: T'Rul Guarded Attache
text: When this personnel is about to be stopped or killed by a dilemma, you may discard a [DS9] personnel from hand to prevent that. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Quark True Ferengi *VP
text: When you play this personnel, you may download a card and place that card beneath your {Ferenginar}. This personnel is Cunning +1 for each Rule you command that has a different card title.

name: Kathryn Janeway Mindful Keeper *VP
text: When any number of your [Voy] personnel present with a cost of 1 or less are about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may stop this personnel to prevent that.

name: A Taste of Armageddon
text: Randomly select a personnel with a skill required by this mission to be killed. The opponent on your left may discard an interrupt from hand to randomly select an additional personnel to be killed.

name: Compromised Tactics
text: Your opponent chooses a personnel they command but do not own. Your copies of that personnel are stopped. Unless you have the skills on that personnel, all your personnel are stopped.

name: Dead Ringer
