text: Your opponent chooses a personnel. You may replace him or her with a personnel in your discard pile that has at least one of the same skills. If you do, place the personnel your opponent chose in your discard pile. Otherwise, all your personnel are stopped.

name: Divide and Conquer
text: When your opponent reveals this dilemma, add 5 to each of this dilemma's attribute requirements for each interrupt in that opponent's discard pile. Unless you have 2 Diplomacy and Cunning>20 or 2 Security and Strength>20, all your personnel are stopped.

name: Intelligent Design
text: Choose a personnel with Cunning>7 to be stopped. If you cannot, place this dilemma in your core. While this dilemmas is in your core, your opponent's Holograms are each attributes +1.

name: Put to the Screws
text: Your opponent names two different skills. Choose one of the named skills. If you have two or more personnel who have that skill, randomly select all but one of those personnel to be stopped.

name: Qualification
text: When your opponent reveals this dilemma, add 5 to each of this dilemma's attribute requirements for each interrupt in that opponent's discard pile. Unless you have 2 Transporters and Integrity>20 or 2 Treachery and Strength>20, all your personnel are stopped.

name: Simulated Prey
text: Randomly select a personnel with a skill required by this mission to be killed. The opponent on your left may discard an interrupt from hand to randomly select an additional personnel to be killed.

name: Blue Match
text: To play this event, you must command three [NA] personnel. Plays in your core. At the start of your turn, you may make each player reveal the bottom card of his or her deck. If you reveal personnel with higher total Strength than each opponent, the first card you play this turn is cost -2.

name: Overrun
text: Plays in your core. While ten or more of your [Bor] personnel are facing a dilemma, you may make each random selection made by that dilemma your choice. This effect lasts until the end of the mission attempt.

name: Red Match
text: To play this event, you must command three [NA] personnel. Plays in your core. At the start of your turn, you may destroy this event to make each player reveal the bottom card of his or her deck. The player that reveals the personnel with the highest total Strength scores 5 points. (In case of a tie, no player scores points.)

name: Thirst for Knowledge
text: When you play this event, it is cost -1 for each space mission you command. Plays in your core. While your personnel are attempting a space mission worth 35 or fewer points, if you command a completed space mission, they are attributes +1.

name: Cold Calculations
text: To play this interrupt, you must command three [Voy] Treachery personnel. When an opponent has chosen dilemmas, you may examine each of the unchosen dilemmas.

name: For Cardassia!
text: To play this interrupt, you must command three [Car] personnel. You may play only one copy of this interrupt each turn. When you complete a mission worth 30 or less points, if you have three or more personnel who cost 1 or less involved, score 10 points. Remove this interrupt from the game.

name: Homeward Bound
text: To play this interrupt, you must command a completed [DQ] space mission and three [Voy] personnel. You may only play one copy of this interrupt each turn. When you play this interrupt, if you command a planet mission, lose 5 points. Order - Unstop each of your stopped personnel at a [DQ] space mission. Remove this interrupt from the game.

name: Rise to the Occasion
text: When your personnel is facing a dilemma, discard a card from hand to make him or her gain all skills on one of your personnel present that costs 1 or less. This effect lasts until the end of that dilemma.

name: Target of Opportunity
text: To play this interrupt, you must command three [NA] personnel. When your opponent reveals a personnel from the top or bottom of his or her deck, you may lose 5 points to place that personnel aboard your ship. (You now command him or her.)

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
name: Alsuran Sector Utilize Abandoned Relay Station
skills: Engineer, Honor, Programming, Cunning>32, and three [Voy] personnel
text: While you command four completed [DQ] space mission, have 100 or more points, and do not command a planet mission, you win the game.

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
name: Briori Sector Investigate Corrosion
skills: Archaeology, Geology, Science, Security, and Cunning>36
text: At the start of your first turn, you may reveal your hand. If you do not reveal an interrupt, you may shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw seven cards.

name: Grid 532 Assimilate Species 10026
text: When you complete this mission, you may place up to three personnel that you command but do not own in their owners' discard piles. Score 5 points for each.

name: Kelsid II Establish Settlement
text: While this mission is complete, the first personnel you play at a [DQ] mission each turn is cost -1.

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
name: Orlitus Cluster Astronomical Survey
text: Each of your personnel here with a cost of 1 or less is attributes +1.

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
name: System J-25 Premature Encounter
text: When you begin a mission attempt here involving ten or more personnel, this mission is worth 5 more points (or worth 10 more points if you have twelve or more personnel involved) until the end of that mission attempt.

name: Tarakis Repair Memorial
skills: Anthropology, Archaeology, Security, Telepathy, and Integrity>32
text: Order - Reveal cards from the top of an opponent's deck equal to the number of personnel on this planet (limit 4). You may do this only once each turn.

name: Terikof Belt Navigate Plasma Storms
skills: 5 Navigation, Cunning>37, and an undamaged ship
text: When your [Maq] or [Car] ship moves from a non-headquarters Region: Badlands mission to another mission, you may begin an engagement at that mission. If you win, draw two cards.

name: Eleven of Eighteen Augmentation Drone
text: When you play an interrupt, if this personnel is attempting a mission and there are nine or more of your [Bor] personnel present, you may place that interrupt on the bottom of your deck.

name: Isotope Drone
text: While this personnel is attempting a mission worth 50 or more points, he is attributes +2.

name: Quantum Drone
text: When you begin a mission attempt involving this personnel and nine or more of your [Bor] personnel present, subtract one from the number of dilemmas your opponent may draw and one from the total cost he or she may spend on dilemmas.

name: Chakotay Steadfast Commander
skills: 2 Anthropology Archaeology Diplomacy Honor Leadership Officer
text: When you begin a mission attempt involving this personnel, if you do not command a planet mission, reduce all attribute requirements of that mission by 2 for each of your completed space missions until the end of that mission attempt.

name: Harry Kim Remorseful Survivor
text: When you play this personnel, you may examine the top four cards of your deck. You may reveal an interrupt or a Temporal card and take it into hand. Place the remaining cards on the bottom of your deck in any order.

name: Mitchell
text: When you play this personnel, he is cost +2 for each planet mission you command.

name: Kathryn Janeway Mindful Keeper
text: When any number of your [Voy] personnel present with a cost of 1 or less are about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may stop this personnel to prevent that.

name: Mortimer Harren Reclusive Genius
text: When you play this personnel, he is cost +2 for each planet mission you command. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may exclude each corresponding Commander present aboard his or her ship from random selections.

name: Tal Celes Imprecise Analyst
text: When you play this personnel, she is cost +2 for each planet mission you command. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, if your corresponding Commander is present and aboard his or her ship, this personnel is attributes +2.

name: William Telfer Misguided Hypochondriac
text: When you play this personnel, he is cost +2 for each planet mission you command. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may lose 5 points to download an interrupt. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Kamok
text: You may play this personnel aboard your [Kli] ship at a non-[AQ] mission at cost -1.

name: Kar'meth
text: You may play this personnel aboard your [Kli] ship at a non-[AQ] mission at cost -1.

name: Nirok
text: You may play this personnel aboard your [Kli] ship at a non-[AQ] mission at cost -1.

name: Feykaab
text: When you reveal cards from the bottom of your deck for a Tsukatse event, you may reveal an additional card.

name: Nimira
skills: Anthropology Exobiology Law Medical Security Telepathy
text: When you play this personnel, you may reveal an interrupt from hand. If you do not, she is stopped.

name: Penk Unscrupulous Promoter
text: When you play this personnel, you may download a Tsunkatse card.

name: Nammoch Travelling Carnival
text: While this ship is staffed and does not have a Damage marker on it, cards your opponents own may not cause your Tsunkatse events to leave play.

name: Worf Son of Mogh *VP
text: When you play this personnel, each opponent draws a card.

name: Historical Curiosity *VP
text: Unless you have Anthropology, Law, and Transporters or Shields>8, randomly select two personnel to be stopped and your opponent draws up to two cards.

name: Stefan DeSeve Disillusioned Expatriate *VP
text: While this personnel is present with a {Dissident} or a [Fed][Cmd] personnel, he is attributes +1.

name: Anachronistic Deviation
text: If you command a [Pa] ship at this mission, randomly select a non-[Pa] personnel to be killed. If you command a non-[Pa] ship at this mission, randomly select a [Pa] personnel to be killed. This dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Dumb Waiter
text: Your opponent reveals one of his or her personnel at this mission. Unless you have the skills on that personnel, your opponent chooses three personnel to be stopped.

name: Strength of Arms
text: Your opponent places a ship you command at this mission. Unless you have Diplomacy and a unique ship at this mission or Treachery and a ship with Weapons>7 at this mission, your opponent chooses a personnel to be stopped.

name: Unsound Logic
text: If your opponent commands an {Assassin} at this mission, he or she chooses a personnel to be killed. If he or she returns that Assassin to his or her hand, he or she chooses an additional personnel to be killed.

name: Emergency Evacuation
text: Plays in your core. While you command more than one ship, destroy this event. Order - Take your personnel aboard your ship and place him or her on this event. Order - Take your personnel from this event and place him or her on your ship.

name: Miracle Working
text: To play this event, you must command a ship with four or more staffing icons. Draw four cards, then place three cards from hand on the bottom of your deck. Destroy this event.

name: New Life
text: To play this event, you must command three [TNG] personnel. Plays in your core. When a player attempts a mission with six or more personnel, he or she draws a card. Then, you draw a card.

name: Pulling Rank
text: Plays on your ship with four or more staffing icons. Your {Admiral} and {General} personnel aboard are the corresponding Commanders of this ship.

name: Relief Efforts
text: Plays in your core. When your personnel on a planet is killed by an opponent's dilemma, you may beam one of your personnel aboard your ship with four or more staffing icons there to the planet (he or she joins the mission attempt). You may do this only once each dilemma.

name: Resilience
text: Plays in your core. While you command exactly one ship, it requires an additional damage card to destroy it.

name: Suppressed Evidence
text: To play this event, you must command three [TNG] personnel. Each player who does not command a completed mission must choose all but two of his or her events to return to their owner's hand. Destroy this event.

name: War Without End
text: Plays in your core. Order - Destroy this event to begin an engagement involving your [AU] ship. If each personnel aboard that ship is [AU], it is Weapons +4. If you win, score 10 points.

name: Zalkonian Storage Capsule
text: Plays in your core. When a card you own causes your opponent to draw a card or reduce a cost, you may examine the top card of your deck. Then you may place the top card of your deck on this event. You may play [TNG] cards on this event as if they were in your hand.

name: Imperial Entanglements
text: To play this interrupt, you must command {Romulus} and no other headquarters missions. When your opponent begins a mission attempt, discard a [Rom] card from hand to download a {D'deridex-class ship} and up to four [Rom] personnel. Place the downloaded ship at that mission and the personnel aboard it. At the end of the mission attempt, shuffle each card you downloaded this way into your deck.

name: Relative Dimensions
text: While your [SF] Engineer aboard your ship is facing a dilemma at a space mission, discard a card from hand to add that ship's Shields to his or her attributes until the end of the mission attempt.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Kaleb Sector Covert Rendezvous
skills: Engineer, Leadership, Navigation, Cunning>34, and a staffed Cloaking Device ship
text: When your mission attempt ends here, you may place your {Cloaking Device} ship here on your {Engage Cloak}.

name: Nelvana III Compelling Threat
skills: Diplomacy, Intelligence, Security, Treachery, and Cunning>34
text: While this mission is complete, increase the attribute requirements of each opponent's mission by the highest Weapons among your staffed ships at that mission.

name: Romulus Patient Stronghold
skills: You may play [Rom] cards and equipment at this mission.
text: You cannot command another headquarters mission. When you play a {D'deridex-class ship}, it is cost -1. When you are about to move your D'deridex-class ship to an opponent's mission, subtract 3 from the span total required.

name: Turo
text: While this personnel is aboard your {Keldon-class ship}, the first {Capture} or {Punishment} event you play each turn is cost -1.

name: Branson
text: While this personnel is aboard your {Sovereign-class ship}, it is attributes +1.

name: Erik Pressman Stern Authoritarian
text: While this personnel is aboard your [TNG] ship, it gains Cloaking Device.

name: Garvey
text: While each player has four or more cards in hand, this personnel is attributes +1 and gains Intelligence and Officer.

name: Homn Lurching Valet
text: When you play this personnel, choose an opponent to draw three cards, then you may draw cards until you have an equal number of cards in hand as that opponent.

name: Kurn Exchange Officer
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a random card from hand to have him gain a skill on a [TNG] personnel in your discard pile until the end of the mission attempt.

name: Lwaxana Troi Psychic Tutor
text: When you play this personnel, you may download up to two cards. Those cards must be {Common Ground}, {Disadvantage Into Advantage}, or {New Life}.

name: Martinez
text: While each player has 40 or more points, this personnel is attributes +1 and gains Diplomacy and Security.

name: Nog Communications Relay
text: While this personnel is aboard your {Defiant-class ship}, each of your [Stf] personnel present loses [Stf] and gains [Cmd].

name: Richardson
text: While each player commands a completed mission, this personnel is attributes +1 and gains Science.

name: Spock Maverick Diplomat
text: When you play this personnel, each player may choose one: download a Diplomacy personnel; remove the bottom card of his or her dilemma pile from the game; or place a personnel from his or her headquarters mission at another mission.

name: St. John Talbot Embittered Consul
text: Add the cost of the highest cost ship at this mission to this personnel's attributes.

name: Kayron
text: While this personnel is aboard your {D'Kora-class ship}, the first {Commodity} or {Rule} event you play each turn is cost -1.

name: Korrd Obsolete Consul
text: Add the cost of the highest cost ship at this mission to this personnel's attributes.

name: Kromm
text: While this personnel is aboard your {Vor'cha-class ship}, the first {Assault} or {Maneuver} event you play each turn is cost -1.

name: Caithlin Dar Innocent Consul
text: Add the cost of the highest cost ship at this mission to this personnel's attributes.

name: Navok
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a [Rom] card from hand to have him gain a skill from your [Rom] personnel at an opponent's mission until the end of that dilemma. You may do this only once each dilemma.

name: Rasul
text: While this personnel is aboard your {D'deridex-class ship}, it is Range +1.

name: Retaya Chemical Agent
text: When your opponent is about to fail a mission attempt here, you may discard an event from hand to randomly kill a personnel involved.

name: Stefan DeSeve Disillusioned Expatriate
text: While this personnel is present with a {Dissident} or a [Fed][Cmd] personnel, he is attributes +1.

name: Tagus
text: When your opponent's personnel at this mission is about to gain a skill as a result of paying a cost, prevent that unless he or she discards a card from hand.

name: Thei Candid Analyst
text: When your opponent is about to choose one or more personnel here for a dilemma you own, randomly select from all eligible personnel instead.

name: Varel
text: When you play this personnel, you may download {Escaping Detection}.

name: U.S.S. Enterprise-E Royal Refuge
text: Order - While you command a personnel you do not own aboard this ship and it is staffed, name another non-[Voy] ship. Each player ignores that ship's game text. This effect lasts until this order is executed again.

name: U.S.S. Defiant Enduring Defender
text: This ship requires an additional damage card to destroy it. While this ship is damaged, it is attributes +2.

name: I.K.S. Negh'Var Imperial Flagship
text: To staff this ship, you must have a {Chancellor} or a {General} aboard. You may use your card which begins combat at this mission even if it is at a headquarters mission.

name: T'Met Timely Reinforcement
text: When the opponent on your right begins a mission attempt at this mission, if this ship is staffed, you may discard two cards (or an event) from hand to draw three extra dilemmas and spend three extra in total cost on dilemmas.

name: Entanglement *VP
text: Your opponent may spend three extra in total cost on dilemmas during this mission attempt.

name: Occupational Hazards *VP
text: Unless you have 2 Acquisition or 2 Treachery, randomly select a personnel to be killed and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Alien Gambling Device *VP
text: When a random selection is made at this mission, you may ignore its result and select again. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Stir Crazy *VP
text: Plays in your core. When the player on your right begins a mission attempt, if he or she has already completed a mission of the same type, you may destroy this event to draw three extra dilemmas and spend three extra in total cost on dilemmas.

name: Reborn *VP
text: To play this interrupt, you must command three [Bor] personnel present together at a non-headquarters mission. Order - Lose 5 points to randomly select an opponent's personnel present with those [Bor] personnel and take command of him or her.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Terrasphere 8 Starfleet Command Re-creation *VP
text: At the start of your turn, if this mission is complete and the opponent on your right has eight or more {Species 8472} dilemmas in his or her core, you win the game.

name: Seven of Nine Efficient Analyst *VP
text: Order - Examine the top two cards of your deck. Replace those cards in any order. Order - Exchange a card in hand with the top card of your deck.

name: Worf Defiant Commander *VP
text: Each of your personnel present who has a cost of 4 or more is attributes +1.

name: Tenak'talar Vanguard of the Occupation *VP
text: This ship is Range +1 for each unique [Car] personnel aboard (limit +3). When your unique Cardassian aboard uses a skill to complete a [Car] mission, if this ship is staffed, score 10 points. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Haakona *VP
text: When you play this ship, you may download {Engage Cloak} or a {Pursuit} card.

name: Taris Deceitful Subcommander *VP
text: When you play this personnel, you may examine an opponent's hand.

name: Alternatives to Fighting
text: Unless you have Navigation and Weapons>7 or this mission is a {Nebula} mission, place your ship at a Nebula mission. If you cannot, all your personnel are stopped and place this dilemma on your ship. Damage - This ship is attributes -2.

name: Becalmed
text: Add the span of this mission to this dilemma's cost. Randomly select three personnel. Each of those personnel with an attribute>6 is stopped.

name: Brave Words
text: Unless the missions you command have greater total span than the mission your opponent commands, your opponent chooses a personnel to be stopped.

name: Cornered
text: Unless you have 2 Astrometrics and 2 Navigation or command a completed mission with span 4 or more, randomly select two personnel to be killed.

name: Dead Weight
text: Each of your personnel who does not have a skill required by this mission is stopped.

name: Accumulated Knowledge
text: When you play this event, it is cost -1 for each dilemma beneath your [SF] missions. Plays in your core. When any number of your [SF] personnel are about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may destroy this event to prevent that.

name: Defiant Reprisal
text: Plays in your core. When your [Maq] personnel is killed by a dilemma, in combat, or in an engagement, you may place that personnel on this event. (You no longer command that personnel.) When your [Maq] personnel is about to be stopped or killed by a dilemma, you may discard a card on this event to prevent that.

name: Chimeric Diversion
text: Plays in your core. When the opponent on your right begins a mission attempt, if the number of dilemmas beneath that mission is greater than its span, you may draw one extra dilemma and spend one extra in total cost on dilemmas.

name: Ignored Jurisdiction
text: Plays on a non-headquarters Region: Demilitarized Zone mission. All players ignore the mission's game text (except keywords and requirements). When a card an opponent owns causes you to lose command of this event, return it to its owner's hand.

name: Respect in Diversity
text: Plays in your core. When you complete a mission, you may unstop any number of your stopped [SF] personnel at that mission. They must each be a different species.

name: Ripple Effect
text: To play this event, you must command three [SF] personnel. Plays on your completed mission. You are considered to command another completed mission of this mission's type.

name: Subspace Rift
text: Plays on a non-headquarters mission. This mission is span 4.

name: Emergency Repairs
text: To play this interrupt, you must command a ship at a mission with span 4 or more. Order - Place your personnel on a dilemma aboard that ship. (Remove that dilemma from the game.) Order - Remove a Damage card on that ship from the game. Order - Make that ship Range +4 until the end of this turn.

name: Perilous Proposal
text: While your [Fed] personnel is facing a dilemma at a mission with span 4 or more, replace all levels of any one skill in that dilemma's requirements with 2 Astrometrics.

name: B'hava'el Prevent Systemic Annihilation
text: When you play a Paranoia event, if this mission is complete, that event is cost -1.

name: Betazed Occupy Homeworld
text: When you attempt this mission, reduce the attribute requirements of this mission by 1 (limit 15) for each opponent's dilemma that has been removed from the game until the end of that mission attempt.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Fed]) may attempt this mission.
name: Deep Space Station K-7 Monitor Federation Commerce
skills: Engineer, Intelligence, Programming, Treachery, and Cunning>34
text: When you play an Infiltrator, if this mission is complete, that personnel is cost -1 and you may place him or her on an opponent's planet mission or aboard an opponent's ship.

text: While this mission is complete, each of your missions with span 4 or more is worth 5 more points.

name: Wixiban Old Friend

skills: Anthropology Astrometrics Biology Programming Science Transporters

name: Nadia Myers
text: While you command a completed space mission, this personnel gains Navigation. While you command two completed space missions, this personnel is attributes +2.

name: Rossi

name: Subspace Rift *VP
text: Plays on a non-headquarters mission. This mission is span 4.

name: Dark Page (IDR)

name: In Development (IDR)

name: A Private Little War (IDR)
text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you have Honor, Medical, Science, and Integrity>32 or Engineer, Security, Treachery, and Strength>32, randomly select a second personnel to be stopped and your opponent may download an equipment.

name: Inhumane Interrogation (IDR)
text: Randomly select a personnel to be killed. You may destroy an event in your core to prevent this.

name: Pillage and Plunder (IDR)
text: Choose a personnel who has Archaeology or Treachery to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

name: Setting the Stage (IDR)
text: Randomly select nine personnel. All your other personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: The Clown: Go Away (IDR)
text: Place this dilemma on this mission. At the start of each of your turns, if you command no personnel or ships at this mission, remove this dilemma from the game. When personnel begin a mission attempt at this mission, randomly select a personnel to be returned to its owner's hand.

name: The First Duty (IDR)
text: Choose a personnel who has Honor or Law to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

name: Hypospray (IDR)
text: When your personnel present is about to be killed by a dilemma, you may stop that personnel and your Medical personnel present to prevent that. You may do this only once each turn.

name: At What Cost? (IDR)
text: Lose 5 points to spend 7 additional counters this turn. Destroy this event.

name: Persistent Strike (IDR)
text: Plays in your core. Order - Begin an engagement involving your Officer personnel. If you win, place this event on an opponent's ship involved. Otherwise, destroy this event. Damage - If this is a non-[Voy] ship, ignore its game text.

name: Product Placement (IDR)
text: Discard an equipment, event, or interrupt from hand to spend two additional counters this turn. Destroy this event.

name: Raise the Stakes (IDR)
text: Plays in your core. Each of your opponent's personnel are attributes +1. Each of your missions are worth 5 more points. When you are about to lose command of this event, remove it from the game instead.

name: Slightly Awkward (IDR)
text: Plays in your core. When a personnel that the player on your right commands begins a mission attempt, you may discard an equipment, event, or interrupt from hand to choose one: draw an extra dilemma; or, spend one extra in total cost on dilemmas.

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
name: Alpha 5 Approach Transport Crash Survivor (IDR)
text: When a player's personnel begin a mission attempt with five or less personnel, the player to the left of that player may draw six extra dilemmas and spend six extra on dilemmas.

name: Automated Server (IDR)

name: Doran (IDR)

name: Garren (IDR)
text: While you command three [Rom] personnel, this personnel is attributes +1, gains Engineer, and becomes [Rom].

name: K'wov (IDR)

name: Sumek (IDR)

name: Olarra (IDR)

name: Unicomplex Root of the Hive Mind *VP
skills: You may play [Bor] cards and equipment at this mission.
text: You cannot command another Headquarters mission.

name: Jean-Luc Picard Starship Captain *VP

text: Order - This personnel loses Diplomacy, Law and Navigation and gains Anthropology, Archaeology and Science until the end of this turn. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner? *VP
text: Choose a personnel who has Diplomacy or Integrity>6 to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

name: Picking Up the Pieces *VP
text: Unless you have Geology or Programming, all your personnel are stopped. If you have two or more personnel who have Geology or Programming, randomly select all but one of those personnel to be stopped.

name: Just Like Old Times *VP
text: Plays in your core. Order - Destroy this event to begin combat involving your Bajoran Resistance personnel. If you win, score 15 points.

name: Tragic Turn *VP
text: Place this dilemma on this mission (limit one per mission). When a dilemma is overcome here, if that dilemma killed any of your personnel, randomly select a personnel attempting the mission to be killed. Otherwise, if that dilemma stopped any of your personnel, randomly select a personnel attempting the mission to be stopped.

name: Disadvantage Into Advantage *VP
text: To play this event, you must command three [TNG] personnel. Plays in your core. The first unique personnel played each turn costs -2.

name: Christening *VP
text: Reveal your hand. If you do not command a ship and you do not reveal a ship from hand, this event is cost -3. Download a ship. Destroy this event.

name: Odo Bajoran Representative *VP
text: To play this personnel, you must command three non-Dissident [TN] personnel. You may play this personnel to {Mouth of the Wormhole} at cost +5 to do any or all of the following: score 5 points, download an equipment, download {Ruling Council}, download a [TN] card.

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
name: Gateway Historical Research *VP
text: At the start of your turn, if this is your first turn and any opponent has had a turn, you may download a personnel.

name: Mila Trusted Confidante *VP
text: When an interrupt is played, you may kill this personnel to prevent that interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile.

name: Pitching In *VP
text: If you have four or more personnel who have a cost of 2 or less attempting this mission, this dilemma is cost -3. Choose a Leadership or Security personnel to be stopped. Then choose an Engineer or Programming personnel to be stopped.

name: After Action Report
text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped for each completed mission you command.

name: Any Methods Necessary
text: Unless you have a Medical personnel who has Integrity<5 or Intelligence, randomly select a personnel to be placed in your opponent's brig, then all your other personnel are stopped.

name: Covert Extraction
text: Choose a personnel who has Intelligence or Transporters to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

name: Disaster
text: Place this dilemma on this mission. When your personnel uses a skill while facing a Damage dilemma here, that personnel is stopped. At the end of this turn, this dilemma is overcome.

name: Hard of Heart
text: Randomly select two personnel. Unless those personnel have Geology and Cunning>11 or Strength>13, those personnel are killed.

name: Historical Pursuit
text: Unless you have Archaeology, Honor, and Transporters or an Artifact equipment, all your personnel are stopped.

name: Journey to the Past
text: Unless you have Anthropology, Geology, Science, and Cunning>34 or Diplomacy, Programming, Security, and Strength>32, randomly select three personnel. Place this dilemma in your core, then place those personnel on this dilemma. At the end of your next turn, remove this dilemma from the game and place all personnel here on a planet or headquarters mission.

name: Know Thy Enemy
text: Reveal your hand and the hand of your opponent on your left. If your opponent reveals personnel with more total Strength than the total Strength of personnel that you have revealed in this way, randomly select one of your personnel to be killed and all your personnel are stopped.

name: Pattern Loss
text: Place this dilemma on this mission (limit one per mission). When a dilemma requiring Transporters is revealed at this mission, add one level of each skill that is in that dilemma's requirements to those requirements until the end of that dilemma.

name: Silent Witness
text: Randomly select two personnel. Each of those personnel who does not have Leadership is killed.

name: Surface Defense
text: Unless you have Archaeology, Exobiology, and Programming or 2 Engineer and 2 Physics, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship at this mission. Damage - To move this ship, you must stop one of your Navigation personnel aboard.

name: Underlying Influence
text: Place this dilemma on this mission (limit one per mission). When a dilemma requiring Archaeology is revealed at this mission, add one level of each skill that is in that dilemma's requirements to those requirements until the end of that dilemma.

name: Unorthodox Recruitment
text: Unless you have Intelligence, randomly select a personnel who has Cunning>6 to be placed in his or her owner's discard pile. If you cannot, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Vanishing Act
text: Unless you have 2 Astrometrics or 2 Transporters, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Denevan Crystals

name: Ro-Kel

name: Zef'No Professional Courier

name: Vreenak Scornful Senator
text: When you play this personnel, the next event you play this turn is cost -2.

name: Disaster *VP
text: Place this dilemma on this mission. When your personnel uses a skill while facing a Damage dilemma here, that personnel is stopped. At the end of this turn, this dilemma is overcome.

name: Logical Solution
text: Choose one: your opponent chooses your personnel with the most [SD] icons to be placed in your discard pile; or if you have at least one card in hand, discard your hand; or all your personnel are stopped.

name: Paradise Found
text: This dilemma is cost +1 for each interrupt in your opponent's discard pile. Unless you have Anthropology, 2 Honor, and 2 Leadership or 2 Astrometrics, 2 Engineer, and Cunning>38, randomly select three personnel to be stopped.

name: V'Ger
text: Unless you have Diplomacy, Exobiology, and Cunning>35 or Archaeology, Programming, and Strength>35, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - You may not play interrupts.

name: Lingering Grief
text: Plays in your core. While your personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard an interrupt (or an Honor personnel) from hand to make that personnel lose all of his or her skills until the end of that dilemma.

name: Practical Evidence
text: Plays on a non-headquarters mission. While a player is attempting this mission, his or her personnel must use Integrity or Cunning to meet Strength requirements.

name: Essential Regrets
text: When your personnel with Integrity>6 is facing a dilemma that is about to return to its owner's dilemma pile, stop that personnel to overcome that dilemma.

name: Ba'ku Planet Safeguard Civilization
text: When you complete this mission, if none of your personnel completing it have Treachery, each player scores 5 points.

name: Seska Pragmatic Agent
text: When you play this personnel, she is cost -1 for each Treachery personnel you command.

name: Dukat Dominion Puppet
text: When you begin a mission attempt involving this personnel, choose a dilemma an opponent owns that has been removed from the game. This personnel gains a skill required by that dilemma until the end of the mission attempt.

name: Christopher Pike Bold Commander
text: You may play this personnel at cost +1 to draw two cards.

name: Worf Noble Warrior
text: When the ship this personnel is aboard is destroyed, you may place any number of Damage cards your opponents own that were on that ship on an opponent's ship at this mission.

name: Quark Cordial Host
text: When this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may exchange him with a non-Artifact equipment from your deck that has a cost of 2 or less. Then shuffle your deck.

name: Kamarag Passionate Orator
text: When you play this personnel, name a personnel. When you play an Assault or Maneuver event, if an opponent commands a unique personnel with that title, that event is cost -1.

name: James Moriarty Awakened Nemesis
text: Order - This personnel gains one skill from your captive or a personnel on your Holoprogram. This effect lasts until this order is executed again.

name: Ru'afo Reluctant "Partner"
text: To play this personnel, you must command three Treachery personnel.

name: Shinzon Devious Tactician
text: While this personnel is at an opponent's mission, each planet or space dilemma revealed here is cost -1.

name: Shran Exchange Officer
text: While this personnel is attempting a mission, your [SF] Human personnel present are Integrity +1.

name: U.S.S. Enterprise-A Olive Branch
text: When you play this ship, it is cost -1 for each of your [Kli] missions. While this ship is at your [Kli] mission, you may attempt and complete it using your [TOS] personnel.

keywords: Commander: I.K.S. Rotarran. General. High Council Member.
name: Martok Soldier of the Empire *VP
text: Each of your [Kli] ships at this mission is Weapons +1.

name: I.K.S. Rotarran Ship of Tears *VP
text: For each Honor Klingon aboard this ship, it is Weapons +1 (limit +3).

name: Miramanee Loyal Priestess
text: Order - Kill this personnel to destroy an event on this mission.

name: Tacking Into the Wind *VP
text: This event is cost -2 for each completed mission the opponent on your left commands. Choose one: download a ship; destroy an event; or shuffle up to ten cards that are personnel or ships from your discard pile into your deck. Remove this event from the game.

name: Risa Shore Leave *VP
skills: Anthropology, and (Archaeology, Science, Treachery, and Cunning>36 or Diplomacy, Exobiology, Officer, and Integrity>32)
text: When you complete this mission, score 5 points for each different species of personnel who uses his or her skills to complete this mission.

name: S'rrel *VP
text: While this personnel is present with your Treachery personnel, he is Strength +2. While this personnel is present with your Honor personnel, he is Integrity +2.

name: S'rrel
text: While this personnel is present with your Treachery personnel, he is Strength +2. While this personnel is present with your Honor personnel, he is Integrity +2.

name: Okala Ahnlo Unsung Hero
text: When you win combat involving this personnel, you may take a personnel from your discard pile into hand.

name: Ceres Ecliptic Intercept Perceived Threat
skills: Intelligence, Navigation, Officer, Security, and Strength>34
text: When you complete this mission, you may destroy any number of your events.

name: Dragon's Teeth
text: Randomly select two personnel. Unless their total cost is greater than the number of cards in your hand, they are killed.

name: Rota Sevrin Deranged Doctor
text: Order - If this personnel is at a non-headquarters mission, you may discard two [NA] cards from hand to randomly select an opponent's non-unique personnel present. You now command that personnel.

name: Kadis-kot
text: Your opponent names a number. Choose one: stop each of your personnel that has a cost higher than that number, or stop each of your personnel that has a cost lower than that number.

name: Harried and Harassed
text: Your opponent chooses his or her staffed ship at another mission and places it at this mission. If he or she commands a Pursuit event, this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Makbar State Jurist
text: When this personnel begins a mission attempt, you may remove a personnel in an opponent's discard pile from the game to make this personnel gain one of the removed personnel's skills until the end of this mission attempt.

name: Orchestrated Attack
text: Plays in your core. Order - Begin an engagement involving your Cloaking Device ship. If you win, place this event and any number of Assassins you command on an opponent's ship involved. Otherwise, destroy this event. Damage - This ship is attributes -1.

name: Nine of Seventeen Multiplexor Drone
text: When you win an engagement involving this personnel, the opponent on your left must place the top card of his or her dilemma pile beneath your mission worth 50 or more points.

name: Zefram Cochrane Breaking History
text: Order - Discard an [AU] card from hand to begin combat involving this personnel. If you win, randomly select an opponent's non-Human personnel involved to be killed.

name: Bread and Circuses
text: Each of your personnel with a cost of 1 or less cannot use their skills while facing this dilemma. Unless you have Archaeology, Diplomacy, and Honor or Exobiology, Transporters, and Treachery, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Brink of War
text: Unless you have 3 Diplomacy or Cunning>40, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, then this dilemma is placed in your core. When an opponent begins an engagement involving one of your ships, each opponent's ship involved is Weapons +2.

name: Flashpoint
text: Your opponent chooses [AU], [Fut], or [Pa]. Randomly select two personnel. Unless neither of those personnel have that icon or both of those personnel have that icon, they are killed.

name: Shaken Confidence
text: When this dilemma is revealed, it is cost -1 for each Paranoia event your opponent commands. Unless you have 2 Intelligence, randomly select three personnel to be stopped.

name: Unfamiliar Etiquette
text: Your opponent chooses an event you command (if he or she cannot, this dilemma is overcome). Unless you choose to destroy that event, stop each personnel with a cost greater than the cost of that event.

name: Weight of Command
text: Randomly select three personnel. Each Officer personnel selected is stopped. Then place each unstopped [Rom] selected at your headquarters mission.

name: Catastrophic Quip
text: Plays in your core. When an opponent's personnel fails a mission attempt, you may destroy this event to stop all personnel at that mission.

name: Desperate Counter
text: Plays in your core. Your [E] ships are attributes +1. While an opponent's personnel is at your mission, your personnel at that mission are attributes -1.

name: Effective Deterrent
text: Plays in your core. When an opponent's mission attempt fails, if your [Rom] ship is at that mission, you may place that ship at your mission.

name: Hidden Strings
text: To play this event, you must command three [Rom] personnel. Plays in your core. Personnel you command but do not own gain Assassin.Order - Stop your [Rom] personnel aboard your {D'deridex-class ship} to place a personnel in your brig aboard that ship. You now command that personnel.

name: Hostilities Unleashed
text: Plays in your core. Order - Discard an event from hand to begin an engagement involving your ship with its corresponding Commander aboard. If you win, randomly select an opponent's personnel involved to be killed. Otherwise, destroy this event. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Particle 010
text: To play this event, you must command three [Bor] personnel. Plays in your core. When you reveal a Persistent dilemma from your dilemma stack, it is cost -1 for each of your mission worth 50 or more points.

name: Pressing On
text: Plays in your core. At the start of each of your turns, place the top card of your deck on this event. Your [Voy] Treachery personnel cannot be killed by planet dilemmas. When your personnel complete a [DQ] planet mission, you may place each [Voy] or Nucleogenic card on this event in its owner's hand.

name: Vendetta
text: Plays in your core. Order - Stop your Genetically Enhanced personnel to examine the top card of your deck, then place it on the top or bottom of your deck or in your discard pile.

name: Well Wishes
text: To play this event, you must command three [TNG] personnel. Plays in your core. When your Honor personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may give command of this event to an opponent to prevent that (move this event to his or her core).

name: The Big Picture
text: When your Admiral is facing a dilemma that requires a skill, destroy your Paranoia event to replace all levels of that skill in that dilemma's requirements with 2 Treachery.

name: Andoria Contact Reclusive Civilization
skills: Diplomacy, Exobiology, Geology, Integrity>34, and (Anthropology or an Andorian)
text: When you complete this mission, you may download a [NA] Telepathy personnel.

name: Delta Pavonis Secure Expansion
skills: Leadership, Officer, Programming, Security, and Cunning>40
text: When you win an engagement, the player to your left places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.

name: Soltok IV Transport "Medical Supplies"
skills: Medical, Navigation, Transporters, Treachery, and Cunning>34
text: At the start of each of your turns, if your staffed [Maq] ship is at this mission, you may draw a card.

name: Heler
text: When you play this personnel, you may draw a card for each mission you command that requires Strength.

name: Dolak Offended Neighbor
text: When you win an engagement involving this personnel, the loser discards the top three cards of his or her deck.

name: Weyoun Shrewd Strategist
text: When you win an engagement involving this personnel, you may remove the top card of the loser's dilemma pile from the game.

name: James Morrow Survivor
text: While this personnel is attempting a mission or is involved in an engagement, you may discard a Nucleogenic card from hand to make the ship he is aboard Weapons +2 and Shields +2 until the end of this turn (limit +6).

name: Pavel A. Chekov Experienced Adept
text: You may play this personnel at cost -2 to ignore his next ability. When you play this personnel, choose one of your [TOS] ships to be attributes +3 until the end of this turn.

name: Ralami
text: While you command a [Fed][Maq] ship, you may play this personnel on a planet mission with an event on it.

name: Valeris Faithless Protegee
text: When you play an Admiral at this mission, you may place a Paranoia card from your discard pile on the bottom of its owner's deck.

name: William T. Riker Facing Apotheosis
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a Q card from hand to make him lose Honor and gain a skill required by this mission until the end of this mission attempt. You may do this only once each turn.

name: K'Ehleyr Uncertain Emissary
text: When this personnel is randomly selected by a dilemma each player may draw a card.

name: Worf Desirous Disciple
text: Each [Kli] personnel present who does not have a staffing icon is Strength +2.

name: Malcolm Reed Protocol Pioneer
text: When an opponent begins an engagement involving this personnel, choose a dilemma beneath this mission. Add the cost of that dilemma to the Shields of the ship this personnel is aboard until the end of this engagement.

name: Scimitar Reman Warbird
text: When you play this ship, it is cost -1 for each Reman at this mission. Each of your [Stf] Reman personnel aboard this ship loses [Stf] and gains [Cmd].

name: Michael Jonas Crafty Mechanic
text: When combat or an engagement begins involving this personnel, you may return him to his owner's hand to make each of your [Maq] cards attributes +1 until the end of this turn.

name: Jim Shimoda Under the Influence
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, reduce each of his attributes by the cost of that dilemma.

name: Polywater Intoxication *VP
text: If you have six or more personnel attempting this mission, this dilemma is cost +3. Choose a personnel to be stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Lwaxana Troi Extraordinary Ambassador *VP
text: When you play this personnel, she is cost -1 for each non-[Fed] personnel you command.

name: Neelix Valued Guide *VP
skills: Acquisition Anthropology Diplomacy Exobiology Honor Navigation
text: This personnel is attributes +1 for each of your completed space missions.

name: Greater Needs *VP
text: Unless you have Anthropology, Diplomacy, Exobiology, and Integrity>30 or Leadership, Transporters, Treachery, and Strength>30, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship at this mission. Damage - Your personnel cannot begin a mission attempt at this mission.

name: Indecent Proposal *VP
text: Randomly select a personnel who costs 5 or more to be stopped. If you cannot, your opponent chooses a personnel to be stopped. If a personnel who costs 5 or more was stopped by this dilemma, return this dilemma to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: No Peace in Our Time *VP
text: Plays in your core. Each of your [Kli] Treachery personnel is Cunning +2. Order - Destroy this event to begin an engagement involving your [Kli] Treachery personnel. If you win, randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved.

name: Standing Your Ground *VP
text: Plays in your core. When you are about to destroy an event to begin an engagement involving your ship with its Commander aboard, you may destroy this card instead to pay that cost.

name: Ja'chuq *VP
text: When you win combat or an engagement involving your [Kli] Leadership personnel, choose one of your missions. The player to your left places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath that mission (that dilemma is overcome). Remove this interrupt from the game.

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
name: Kavis Alpha Research Binary Star *VP
skills: Anthropology, Biology, Medical, and any attribute>32
text: When an opponent's personnel is stopped by your {Infestation}, he or she chooses another personnel facing that dilemma to be stopped.

name: Fifth Neonatal Drone *VP
text: When you play this personnel, you may return a non-dilemma card on your Decay event to its owner's hand.

name: Jean-Luc Picard Argo Pilot *VP
skills: Archaeology Diplomacy Honor Leadership Navigation Officer
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a card from hand to download {Escape}.

name: Kerla Military Advisor *VP
text: When you win an engagement involving this personnel, you may place him on the bottom of his owner's deck to choose one of your non-headquarters missions. The player on your left places the top card of his or her dilemma pile beneath that mission.

name: Assimilator Rogue Borg Vessel
text: When you play this ship, it is cost -1 for each Borg you command (limit 5). You may play {[NA] Borg} and {Treachery Androids} aboard this ship.

name: Aceton Assimilators
text: Your opponent names a dilemma. Search your dilemma pile for a copy of that dilemma and place it beneath your opponent's non-headquarters mission, then choose a personnel to be stopped for each copy of that dilemma beneath your opponent's missions. Shuffle and replace your dilemma pile.

name: Dereliction of Duty
text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Your personnel at this mission cannot use their abilities. At the end of this mission attempt, this dilemma is overcome.

name: Space Seed
text: This dilemma is cost -1 for each Genetically Enhanced personnel this dilemma's owner commands. Unless you have 3 Security and Strength>40 or 2 Telepathy and Cunning>40, randomly select two personnel. If this dilemma's owner commands {To Rule in Hell}, he or she may place those personnel on {Ceti Alpha V} to take command of them (they become [NA]).

name: Agonizer
text: When your [AU][Pa] personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may stop another [AU][Pa] personnel present to prevent that. You may do this only once each dilemma.

name: Breen CRM 114
text: While in combat, each of your Breen personnel present is Strength +3. When any number of your personnel present are about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may stop your Smuggler present and remove this equipment from the game to prevent that.

name: Keevan
text: This equipment is cost -1 if you command a Ferengi Engineer personnel. When any number of your personnel present are about to be killed, you may place this card in your opponent's hand to prevent that.

name: Mobile Emitter
text: While your Hologram present is facing a dilemma, you may discard a card from hand to make that personnel gain a skill from a personnel on your Holoprogram. This effect lasts until the end of the mission attempt. You may do this only once each turn.

name: TR-116 Rifle
text: While in combat, each of your [Fed] Treachery personnel present is Strength +1. Order - If this equipment is present with your Assassin, name a skill. Choose an opponent's personnel present with that skill. Return this equipment to its owner's hand to kill that personnel.

name: Universal Translator
text: Each of your Officer personnel present gains Diplomacy.

name: Devastating Melee
text: To play this event, you must command three [Dom] personnel. Plays in your core. Order - Destroy this event to begin combat involving your personnel. If you win, randomly select a number of opposing personnel to be killed equal to the number of your Hand Weapons equipped by your personnel involved (limit 3).

name: New Power Rising
text: To play this event, you must command three [TN] personnel. Spend an additional counter this turn for each opponent's dilemma that has been removed from the game (limit 5). Remove this event from the game.

name: Repurposed Transmission
text: This event is cost -1 for each Dissident you command. Plays in your core. When an opponent plays an interrupt, if that opponent has a copy of that interrupt in his or her discard pile, you may destroy this event to prevent that interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile.

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
name: Hyralan Sector Raid Flagship
skills: Archaeology, Security, Treachery, Strength>32, and 3 Thief personnel
text: Order - If this mission is complete, place an Artifact equipment from your discard pile aboard your [NA] ship at this mission. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Torman V Conduct "Legitimate" Commerce
text: When you complete this mission, you may place up to three of your non-Hand Weapon equipment on this planet in their owners' discard piles. Score 5 points for each.

name: Vandros IV Restore Iconian Gateway
skills: Officer, Security, Strength>35, a Hand Weapon, and (Archaeology or Leadership)
text: Order - If this mission is complete, place any number of your Jem'Hadar and/or Hand Weapons from this planet on any player's ship or planet mission.

name: Miles O'Brien Ill-Equipped Storyteller
text: While this personnel is equipped with an Orb, he is Integrity +2 and gains Anthropology.

name: One Peerless
skills: Astrometrics 2 Engineer Exobiology 2 Honor Navigation Physics 2 Programming Security Transporters
text: While you command a [Bor] non-Dissident personnel, this personnel loses all of his skills.

name: Ekoor
text: When you play this personnel, you may download {Arrest Order}.

name: Chu'lak Calculating Killer
text: When you play this personnel, you may download a Hand Weapon. While this personnel is equipped with a Hand Weapon, he gains 2 Treachery.

name: Ro Laren Proven Expert
text: Order - Name a card. This personnel is attributes +1 for each copy of that card in an opponent's discard pile. This effect lasts until this order is executed again.

name: Jean-Luc Picard "Hero of Maxia"
text: While this personnel is aboard your ship at an opponent's mission, add the number of cards beneath your {Ferenginar} to each of that mission's attribute requirements.

name: Nog Drill Instructor
text: Order - Discard an equipment from beneath your {Ferenginar} to place a captive you command at your headquarters mission. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Fek'lhr Diabolical Warden
text: To play this personnel, you must remove three Klingon personnel in your discard pile from the game.

name: Molly O'Brien Time's Orphan
text: When your opponent plays an interrupt without paying a cost, you may remove this personnel from the game to prevent that interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile.

keywords: Admiral. Assassin. Cadet. Dabo Girl. Dissident. Gatherer. General. High Council Member. Infiltrator. Senator. Smuggler. Thief. Waiter.
name: Seven of Nine Immersed in Chaos
U.S.S. Stargazer Dangerous Gift
text: When the opponent on your right begins a mission attempt at this mission, name a personnel. Each opponent's personnel with that card title is stopped.

name: Frame of Mind
text: Unless you have 3 Security or 2 Telepathy or {William T. Riker}, randomly select all but one of your personnel. Place them on the bottom of your deck, then reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal the same number of personnel cards. You now command those personnel, they join the mission attempt (discard any duplicate unique personnel). Place the other revealed cards on the bottom of your deck.

name: Hazardous Materials
text: For each {Trellium-D} the opponent on your left commands, randomly select a personnel to be killed. Unless you have Engineer, Medical, and Security or Anthropology, Navigation, and Officer, place this dilemma on your ship. Damage - When your opponent plays an equipment that costs 1 or more, randomly select a personnel aboard this ship to be killed.

name: Macrovirus
text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you have 2 Exobiology and 2 Science or Medical, Security, and a Hand Weapon, that personnel is killed and this dilemma is placed on your ship at this mission. Damage - When your opponent plays an interrupt on his or her turn, randomly select a personnel aboard this ship to be killed.

name: Subspace Fracture
text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you have 2 Geology and 2 Transporters or Honor, Officer, and a non-Hand Weapon equipment, that personnel is killed and this dilemma is placed on your ship at this mission. Damage - When your opponent plays an event that costs 2 or more, randomly select a personnel aboard this ship to be killed.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Empok Nor Deadly Salvage
text: When your personnel are about to face a dilemma here, randomly select one of those personnel to be killed.

name: Data Masquerading Monarch
text: This personnel is Cunning +1 and Strength +1 for each different non-unique personnel present (limit +4).

name: Jadzia Dax Conversant Veteran
text: When this personnel is about to be captured or killed, you may stop her to prevent that.

name: James T. Kirk Organizing Crime
text: You may play this personnel at cost +1 to have him gain [Cmd] and Commander: {U.S.S. Enterprise} until the end of this turn. When an opponent scores any number of points, draw a card for every 5 points scored.

name: Charles Tucker III Horse Trader
text: When you play this personnel, you may download a non-Artifact equipment. Order - Place your equipment present on the bottom of its owner's deck to draw two cards. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Arctus Baran Mercenary Captain *VP
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a card from hand to download {Shady Resources}.

name: Excalbian Drama *VP
text: When your opponent reveals this dilemma, he or she may discard any number of cards from hand. For each card discarded this way, add 5 Integrity to this dilemma's requirements. Unless you have Integrity>30, all your personnel are stopped.

name: Fortune *VP
text: When you play this ship, you may download a [NA] Archaeology personnel.

name: Queen's Borg Cube *VP
text: You may use a card which begins an engagement to begin one involving this ship even if it is at a headquarters mission.

name: Inferiority *VP
text: Place this dilemma in your core. When your personnel begin a mission attempt, your opponent may remove this dilemma from the game to draw three extra dilemmas and spend three extra in total cost on dilemmas.

name: Temporal Misalignment *VP
text: Randomly select X personnel to be stopped.

name: Rule of Acquisition #6 *VP
text: To play this event, you must command three [Fer] personnel. Plays in your core. You cannot spend counters to draw cards. (You do not need to spend all your counters during each of your turns.) Order - Stop one of your [Fer] personnel to draw a card.

name: Explicit Orders *VP
text: When your [Dom] personnel is attempting a mission, discard a [Dom] personnel of a different species from hand to make him or her gain the discarded personnel's skills until the end of that mission attempt.

name: Archaic Snare
text: Unless you have Archaeology, 2 Security, and Cunning>32 or 3 Engineer, Navigation, and Physics, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on this mission. When a ship is about to move from this mission, randomly select a personnel aboard to be killed.

name: Santos Squad Leader *VP
text: While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may destroy your event to add that event's cost to this personnel's attributes until the end of that mission attempt.

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
name: Sphere 41 Eliminate Sphere Network *VP
skills: Astrometrics, Leadership, Navigation, Security, and Cunning>40 or Engineer, 2 Leadership, and Strength>46

name: B-4 Dangerous Simpleton *VP
text: While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may reveal three Androids from hand to make him Cunning +7 and gain Intelligence and Treachery. These effects last until the end of the mission attempt. You may only do this once each turn.

name: U.S.S. Enterprise Where She Belongs *VP
text: You may play this ship at cost -4 to ignore its next ability. When you play this ship, you may download a [TOS] personnel who has a cost of 4 or more and play him or her at cost -4 aboard this ship.

name: Divergent Goals
text: Randomly select three personnel. Unless those personnel have Anthropology, Geology, and Integrity>17 or your unselected personnel have Biology, Officer, and 2 Transporters, all your personnel are stopped.

name: Environmental Contaminants
text: While you have a higher score than each of your opponents, this dilemma is cost -3. Unless you have Biology, 2 Diplomacy, and 2 Science or 2 Engineer, 2 Exobiology, and Cunning>38, randomly select two personnel to be killed.

name: Interstellar Exigence
text: Choose a Law personnel to be stopped, then randomly select an additional personnel to be stopped for each headquarters mission the opponent on your left commands.

name: Isolated Detachment
text: Randomly select three personnel. Unless those personnel have Diplomacy, Programming, and Cunning>17 or your unselected personnel have Engineer, Physics, and 2 Security, all your personnel are stopped.

name: Casualties of the Occupation
text: To play this event, you must command [HQ] {Bajor} and [HQ] {Cardassia Prime}. Plays in your core. Order - Remove a [Baj] card in your discard pile from the game to make each of your [Car] personnel attributes +1 until the end of your turn (limit +3).

name: Covert Collusion
text: To play this event, you must command two [Car] personnel and two [Rom] personnel. Plays in your core. At the start of your turn, discard the top two cards of your deck. If you discarded a [Car] Intelligence personnel or a [Rom] Intelligence personnel in this way, the first personnel you play this turn is cost -2. Order - Destroy this event to download {D'deridex Advanced} or {Keldon Advanced}.

name: Death's Shadow
text: Plays in your core. When your [Car] personnel is killed by a dilemma or in combat, you may place him or her on this event. (You no longer command him or her.) When an opponent plays an event, you may place a personnel from this event in his or her owner's discard pile to prevent that event and place it in its owner's discard pile.

name: Soft Sell
text: Plays on an opponent's incomplete non-headquarters mission. While this mission is complete, each of your Smuggler personnel and Thief personnel are Cunning +1 and Strength +1.

name: The Stars Are Made of Latinum
text: To play this event, you must command {Ferenginar} and {Founders' Homeworld}. Plays on your headquarters mission (limit one per mission). When your ship here moves to a mission in a different quadrant, you may download a Commodity. While your opponent commands a Commodity, your ships are Range +2.

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
name: Deneb Approach Exploratory Quandary
skills: Archaeology, Diplomacy, Honor, Law, and (Cunning>32 or Strength>32)
text: Your maximum deck size is 40 cards.

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
name: Q's Planet Enticing Diversion
skills: Anthropology, Leadership, Officer, Science, and (Cunning>34 or Strength>34)
text: When you begin a mission attempt here with six or more personnel, if you have completed {Deneb Approach}, you may take a personnel from your discard pile into your hand.

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
name: Sector 39-J Investigate Annihilation
skills: Astrometrics, Navigation, Physics, Science, and Cunning>34
text: This mission is span -1 for each completed mission an opponent commands (limit -2).

name: Purification Drone
text: At the start of your first turn, if you command {Unicomplex}, you may discard this card from hand to draw a card for each of your missions worth 50 or more points.

name: Surjak
text: To play this personnel, kill one of your Bajoran personnel.

name: Ishka Opportunistic Hostage
text: While this personnel is on a planet or aboard a ship, if you command {Ferenginar}, you may play [Fer] personnel on that planet or ship.

name: Keevan Pragmatic Captor
text: Cards you own cannot make this personnel leave an opponent's brig. Order - If you have no captives and command six [TN] personnel, place this personnel in your opponent's brig to name a personnel. That opponent places each copy of that personnel he or she commands in your brig.

name: Remata'Klan Steadfast Sentinel
text: When an opponent plays an event or interrupt, you may place your captive he or she owns on his or her ship or headquarters mission to prevent that event or interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile.

name: Gant
text: When an opponent plays an interrupt, if you do not command a completed mission, you may place this personnel beneath your {Ferenginar} to prevent that interrupt and shuffle it into its owner's deck.

name: Levin
text: At the start of your first turn, if you command {Ferenginar}, you may discard this card from hand to download a non-Artifact Commodity event.

name: Ortakin
text: At the start of your first turn, if you command {Qo'noS}, you may discard this card from hand to draw a card for each non-headquarters mission you command that requires Treachery.

name: Olamu
text: While you command three [Baj] personnel, this personnel is attributes +1, gains Diplomacy, and becomes [Baj].

name: Qatai Determined Hunter
skills: Exobiology Leadership Navigation Physics Security Transporters
text: While an opponent commands a completed mission, this personnel cannot be killed by dilemmas. While an opponent commands two completed missions, this personnel cannot be stopped by dilemmas.

name: Rodriguez
text: When you play this personnel, if you command {Khan Noonien Singh}, he is cost -2.

name: Sfreett Deadly Flower
text: While this personnel is present with a [Fed] personnel, a [Kli] personnel, and a [Rom] personnel, she gains Diplomacy, Security, and Treachery and cannot be stopped by dilemmas.

name: Zon Fated Challenger
text: This personnel is Strength +2 for each completed mission your opponents command (limit +6).

name: U.S.S. Oberth
text: You may play this ship at your {Earth}. At the start of your first turn, if you command Earth, you may reveal this card from hand to make each player draw a card.

name: Shining So Bright
text: Plays in your core. When you play a [Cmd] Leadership personnel, you may examine the top card of your deck, then place it on the top or bottom of your deck.

name: The Enemy of My Enemy
text: When your [Car] personnel is facing a dilemma, discard the top three cards of your deck to make that personnel gain all skills, attributes, and keywords on a [Car] personnel in your discard pile until the end of the dilemma.

name: Odo Vigilant Staffer
text: You may play this personnel aboard your [TOS] ship. When your [Pa] personnel present is about to be killed by a dilemma, you may return this personnel to his owner's hand to prevent that.

name: Damar Martyred Outlaw
text: When you play this personnel, discard a card from hand. When this personnel is killed by a dilemma or in combat, you may place up to three [Car] Dissidents from your hand at your headquarters mission where they could be played.

name: Dukat Erstwhile Ally
text: Order - Discard a card from hand to begin an engagement involving your [Dom] personnel or your [DS9] personnel. You may do this only once each turn.

name: Elim Garak Imposing Patriot
text: When you play this personnel, discard a card from hand. When you play this personnel, you may download {For Cardassia!} or a Hand Weapon equipment.

keywords: Commander: I.K.S. Negh'Var. Founder. General. Infiltrator. Shape-shifter.
name: Martok Founder False Flag Officer
text: You may play this personnel at your {Qo'noS}. While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may meet Integrity requirements with Strength instead.

name: Benjamin Sisko Resourceful Captain
text: While this personnel is at a [Dom] mission, he is attributes +1. Order - This personnel gains a skill required by your [Dom] mission. This effect lasts until this order is executed again.

name: Cal Hudson Nostalgic Rebel
text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a card from hand to make him lose a skill until the end of that dilemma. You may do this only once each dilemma.

name: Jean-Luc Picard Compassionate Advocate
skills: Anthropology Archaeology 2 Diplomacy Honor Law Officer
text: To play this personnel, you must command three [Baj] personnel.

name: Quark Practical Apologist
text: When you play this personnel, you may download a Jem'Hadar personnel and place it beneath your {Ferenginar}. While attempting a mission, your [TN] personnel present may use Strength to meet Cunning requirements.

name: Arne Darvin "Hero of the Empire"
text: When your {Infestation} stops a personnel, you may stop this personnel to kill that stopped personnel.

name: Enabran Tain Prideful Director
text: When your opponent is about to fail a mission attempt at this mission, randomly select a personnel involved to be placed in your brig.

name: Naprem Renegade Vessel
text: When you win an engagement involving your [Dom] personnel or your [DS9] personnel, choose one: remove the top two cards of the loser's dilemma pile from the game; or randomly kill an opponent's Leadership personnel involved. You may do this only once per turn.

name: Niala Intelligence Asset
text: To play this ship, you must command three [Car] Dissident personnel. When you play this ship, discard two cards from hand. While you have a [Car] Dissident aboard, this ship is attributes +1.

name: I.K.S. Negh'Var Infiltrated Flagship
text: You may play this ship at {Qo'noS} (it becomes [Kli]). To staff this ship, you must have a {Chancellor}, {Founder}, or {General} aboard. While attempting a mission, your Chancellors, Founders, and Generals at this mission are each attributes +1.

name: Salvaged Attack Ship Sheep in Wolf's Clothing
text: While this ship is at a [Dom] mission, this ship and each of your [DS9] personnel at this mission are attributes +1.

name: U.S.S. Enterprise-D Humanitarian Envoy
text: When you play this ship, if you command three [Baj] personnel, each player may place a personnel from hand on a headquarters mission where he or she could be played. (Yours must be a [Fed][DS9] personnel.)

name: Serrola Tip of the Spear
text: While your [Rom] Intelligence personnel is aboard this ship, this ship is attributes +2. When your dilemma stops an opponent's personnel here, if no personnel have been stopped by a dilemma during that attempt, that opponent discards two cards from hand.

name: Navaar Experienced Gift *VP
text: When a Thief present is facing a dilemma, you may destroy your event to have that Thief gain a skill of your choice until the end of that mission attempt.

name: Black Operation
text: To play this event, you must command six Cadet personnel. Plays in your core. When an event or interrupt is played, you may place a Paranoia card from hand on this event to prevent that event or interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile.

name: Intoxicating Spirits
text: When an interrupt is played, if you command a Waiter personnel, you may give command of this event to an opponent to prevent that interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile. While you command but do not own this event, each player's Waiter personnel is attributes +1.

name: Bait and Switch
text: To play this interrupt, you must command three Crime events. When an opponent plays an event in his or her core, prevent that event and place it in your core. (You now command that event.)

name: Moment of Triumph
text: When an event is played, if the number of Genetically Enhanced personnel you command is greater than the cost of that event, prevent that event and place it in its owner's discard pile. Order - Stop your Genetically Enhanced personnel to destroy an event with a cost less than that personnel's.

name: Paradise Lost
text: To play this interrupt, you must command two Paranoia events. When an event or interrupt is played, randomly destroy one of your Paranoia events to prevent that event or interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile. Then, if you command three or more Admiral personnel, shuffle this card into your deck.

name: Recessive Mutation
text: When an event or interrupt is played, place two of your non-unique [Bor] Dissident personnel on the bottom of their owner's deck to prevent that event or interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile. Order - Stop your [Bor] Dissident personnel to destroy an opponent's event with a cost less than that personnel's.

name: Reprimand
text: To play this interrupt, you must command two missions worth 50 or more points each. When an event or interrupt is played, prevent that event or interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile.

name: Chell Incessant Chatterbox
text: When your opponent plays an interrupt, you may place this personnel from hand aboard your [Fed][Voy] ship and lose 5 points to prevent that interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile.

name: The Devil Fearsome Illusion
text: When an interrupt is played, you may place this personnel on your Holoprogram to prevent that interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile. (You no longer command this personnel.)

name: Lapideas System Geological Survey *VP
text: When you complete this mission, if your personnel completing it have 2 Acquisition or 2 Geology, score 5 points.

name: Arresting Display
text: Unless you have Anthropology, Security, and Telepathy or 2 Exobiology, Medical, and Cunning>38, all your personnel are stopped. If you played an interrupt while facing this dilemma, place this dilemma in your core. To play an interrupt, you must discard an interrupt from hand.

name: Compromised Experiment
text: The opponent on your left chooses an event you command. Randomly select a number of personnel to be stopped equal to that event's Decay number.

name: Elemental Instability
text: The opponent on your left chooses a personnel to be killed for each {Trellium-D} you command. Unless you have 2 Engineer and 2 Science or 2 Acquisition and 2 Biology, choose two [Cmd] personnel to be stopped.

name: Overindulgence
text: The opponent on your left names a skill. If you have five or more of that skill, all your personnel are stopped.

name: Threading the Needle
text: Unless you have 2 Navigation, 2 Officer, and Transporters or 2 Engineer, 2 Programming, and Strength>38, all your personnel are stopped. Otherwise, place this dilemma on this mission. Ships cannot move from this mission. At the end of this turn, this dilemma is overcome.

name: Xenophobic Outburst
text: Randomly select three personnel. If each personnel is a different affiliation, they are killed. Otherwise, choose one of those personnel to be stopped.

name: The Shroud of the Sword
text: Each of your Klingon personnel present are Cunning +1. Order - Destroy this equipment to download {The Sword of Kahless}.

name: A History of Collusion
text: Plays in your core. When you play a [Kli] Smuggler personnel, choose an event in an opponent's core. That opponent may destroy that event. If he or she does not, the next [Kli] card you play this turn is cost -2.

name: Lethal Wound
text: Plays in your core. When a personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, if that stop is prevented, kill that personnel.

name: Psychotic Impulse
text: To play this event, you must command three [AU][Baj] personnel. Kill any number of captives in your brig and/or your Human personnel. If the total cost of personnel killed in this way was 7 or more, score 5 points. Remove this event from the game.

name: Racial Disdain
text: To play this event, you must command three [AU][Kli] personnel. Plays in your core. When your [AU][Kli] personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may remove an [AU] Human personnel in your discard pile (or a captive in your brig) from the game to prevent that.

name: Shocking Revelation
text: Plays on an opponent's incomplete non-headquarters mission. When your opponent completes this mission, if you command an Infiltrator, choose a personnel involved, place them on your headquarters mission, and name an affiliation. They become the named affiliation. (You now command that personnel.)

name: Axiana Secure Colony
skills: Navigation, Science, 2 Security, and Strength>33 or 2 Diplomacy, 2 Honor, and Integrity>33

name: Bajor Terok Nor
skills: You may play [AU][Baj] cards, [AU][Car] cards, [AU][Fer] cards, [AU][Kli] cards, [AU][Non] cards, and equipment at this mission.
text: You cannot command another headquarters mission. Each non-unique [Car] personnel and non-unique [Kli] personnel you own gains [AU].

name: Boreth Place of Questions
text: At the start of your first turn, if you command {Qo'noS}, you may download {Kahless}.

name: Denorios Belt Silence Prophets
skills: Archaeology, Officer, Transporters, 2 Treachery, and Cunning>35
text: When you complete this mission, destroy all events.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
name: Nimbus III Hostage Crisis
skills: Diplomacy, Medical, Navigation, Security, and (Cunning>36 or Strength>36)
text: At the start of each player's turn, if this mission is complete, that player chooses one of their missions and places the top card of their opponent's dilemma pile beneath that mission.

name: Ezri Tigan Cynical Mercenary
text: When you play this personnel, you may shuffle any number of [AU][NA] personnel from your discard pile into your deck.

name: Romara Cal Personal Physician
